1. In a bowl, beat the eggs, and stir in the baby spinach and Parmesan cheese. Season with onion powder, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
  2. In a small skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heat, cook the egg mixture about 3 minutes, until partially set. Flip with a spatula, and continue cooking 2 to 3 minutes. Reduce heat to low, and continue cooking 2 to 3 minutes, or to desired doneness.

Microwave Scalloped Potatoes.originalString: 1/2 teaspoon dried parsley, or to taste (optional)
Microwave Scalloped Potatoes.name: dried parsley

Microwave Scalloped Potatoes.originalString: 1 pinch ground paprika, or to taste (optional)
Microwave Scalloped Potatoes.name: ground paprika

Microwave Scalloped Potatoes:
1. Place potatoes, onion, and butter in a large microwave-safe dish.
  2. Mix flour and salt in a bowl; sprinkle over potatoes and gently toss until vegetables are coated.
  3. Pour milk over the potatoes.
  4. Cook in the microwave on high setting until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes, stirring every 5 minutes.
  5. Allow potatoes to rest for 5 minutes before sprinkling with parsley and paprika for serving.
Salsa Chicken:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
  2. Place chicken breasts in a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle taco seasoning on both sides of chicken breasts, and pour salsa over all.
  3. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 25 to 35 minutes, or until chicken is tender and juicy and its juices run clear.
  4. Sprinkle chicken evenly with cheese, and continue baking for an additional 3 to 5 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Top with sour cream if desired, and serve.

Ultimate Breakfast Casserole.originalString: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
Ultimate Breakfast Casserole.name: condensed cream of chicken soup

Ultimate Breakfast Casserole.originalString: 1 (2 pound) package frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
Ultimate Breakfast Casserole.name: hash brown potatoes

Ultimate Breakfast Casserole:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
  2. Season beaten eggs with pepper; pour into baking dish. In a large bowl, combine soup, sour cream, hash browns, ham, onion and cheese.
  3. Mix thoroughly and pour over eggs.
  4. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes.
  5. Remove and drizzle butter over top of casserole. Return to oven and bake for an additional 15 minutes, until golden.

Chef John's Perfect Mashed Potatoes.originalString: 3 large russet potatoes, peeled and cut in half lengthwise
Chef John's Perfect Mashed Potatoes.name: russet potatoes

Chef John's Perfect Mashed Potatoes.originalString: salt and ground black pepper to taste
Chef John's Perfect Mashed Potatoes.name: ground pepper

Chef John's Perfect Mashed Potatoes:
1. Place the potatoes into a large pot, and cover with salted water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, 20 to 25 minutes.
  2. Drain, and return the potatoes to the pot. Turn heat to high, and allow the potatoes to dry for about 30 seconds. Turn off the heat.
  3. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher twice around the pot, then add the butter and milk. Continue to mash until smooth and fluffy.
  4. Whisk in the salt and black pepper until evenly distributed, about 15 seconds.
Pan Seared Salmon I:
1. Preheat a large heavy skillet over medium heat for 3 minutes.
  2. Coat salmon with olive oil.
  3. Place in skillet, and increase heat to high. Cook for 3 minutes. Sprinkle with capers, and salt and pepper. Turn salmon over, and cook for 5 minutes, or until browned. Salmon is done when it flakes easily with a fork.
  4. Transfer salmon to individual plates, and garnish with lemon slices.
Brown Sugar Smokies:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Cut bacon into thirds and wrap each strip around a little sausage.
  3. Place the wrapped sausages on wooden skewers, several to a skewer. Arrange the skewers on a baking sheet and sprinkle them liberally with brown sugar.
  4. Bake until bacon is crisp and the brown sugar melted.
Buttery Cooked Carrots:
1. Cook carrots in a large pot of boiling water until tender.
  2. Drain off most of the liquid, leaving bottom of pan covered with water. Set the carrots aside.
  3. Stir margarine and brown sugar into the water. Simmer and stir until the margarine melts. Return carrots to the pot, and toss to coat. Cover, and let sit for a few minutes to allow flavors to mingle.
Spicy Bean Salsa: 1. In a medium bowl, combine black-eyed peas, black beans, corn, onion, green bell pepper, jalapeno peppers and tomatoes. Season with Italian-style salad dressing and garlic salt; mix well. Cover, and refrigerate overnight to blend flavors.
Monkey Bread I:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease one 9 or 10 inch tube/Bundt(R) pan.
  2. Mix white sugar and cinnamon in a plastic bag.
  3. Cut biscuits into quarters. Shake 6 to 8 biscuit pieces in the sugar cinnamon mix. Arrange pieces in the bottom of the prepared pan. Continue until all biscuits are coated and placed in pan. If using nuts and raisins, arrange them in and among the biscuit pieces as you go along.
  4. In a small saucepan, melt the margarine with the brown sugar over medium heat. Boil for 1 minute.
  5. Pour over the biscuits.
  6. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 minutes.
  7. Let bread cool in pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a plate. Do not cut! The bread just pulls apart.

Asian Lettuce Wraps.originalString: 16 Boston Bibb or butter lettuce leaves
Asian Lettuce Wraps.name: butter lettuce leaves

Asian Lettuce Wraps.originalString: 1 dash Asian chile pepper sauce, or to taste (optional)
Asian Lettuce Wraps.name: pepper sauce

Asian Lettuce Wraps.originalString: 1 (8 ounce) can water chestnuts, drained and finely chopped
Asian Lettuce Wraps.name: canned water chestnuts

Asian Lettuce Wraps:
1. Rinse whole lettuce leaves and pat dry, being careful not tear them. Set aside.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef and cooking oil in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
  3. Drain and discard grease; transfer beef to a bowl. Cook and stir onion in the same skillet used for beef until slightly tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir hoisin sauce, garlic, soy sauce, vinegar, ginger, and chile pepper sauce into onions.
  4. Add water chestnuts, green onions, sesame oil, and cooked beef; cook and stir until the onions just begin to wilt, about 2 minutes.
  5. Arrange lettuce leaves around the outer edge of a large serving platter and pile meat mixture in the center.
Lemon Garlic Tilapia:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray a baking dish with non-stick cooking spray.
  2. Rinse tilapia fillets under cool water, and pat dry with paper towels.
  3. Place fillets in baking dish.
  4. Pour lemon juice over fillets, then drizzle butter on top. Sprinkle with garlic, parsley, and pepper.
  5. Bake in preheated oven until the fish is white and flakes when pulled apart with a fork, about 30 minutes.
Hash Brown Quiche:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
  2. Press hash browns onto the bottom and sides of a 9 inch pie dish.
  3. Drizzle with melted butter, and sprinkle with seasoning salt.
  4. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until beginning to brown.
  5. In a small bowl, combine ham, onion and shredded cheese. In a separate bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and a little seasoning salt. When crust is ready, spread ham mixture on the bottom, then cover with egg mixture.
  6. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C.)
  7. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, or until filling is puffed and golden brown.
Pine Cone Cheese Ball:
1. Stir cream cheese, goat cheese, parsley, tarragon, thyme, garlic, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper together in a bowl until smooth and well-mixed.
  2. Turn cheese mixture out onto a serving platter and form into a tapered oval shape to resemble a pine cone.
  3. Starting at the tapered end, press almonds into the cheese cone so that the tip of the almond is facing out and down, and cheese cone is completely covered with almonds and resembles a pine cone.
  4. Place rosemary sprigs at the top to resemble pine needles.

Homefried Potatoes with Garlic and Bacon.originalString: 2 russet potatoes, quartered and thinly sliced
Homefried Potatoes with Garlic and Bacon.name: russet potatoes

Homefried Potatoes with Garlic and Bacon:
1. Fry the bacon in a large deep skillet over medium-high heat until evenly browned and crisp.
  2. Remove from the pan, and add the potatoes and onions to the bacon drippings. Season with garlic pepper. Reduce the heat to medium, and cook the potatoes for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender and browned. Crumble bacon over the top before serving.
Spinach and Potato Frittata:
1. Heat olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat.
  2. Place potatoes in the skillet, cover, and cook about 10 minutes, until tender but firm.
  3. Mix in spinach, green onions, and garlic. Season with salt and pepper. Continue cooking 1 to 2 minutes, until spinach is wilted.
  4. In a medium bowl, beat together eggs and milk.
  5. Pour into the skillet over the vegetables. Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook 5 to 7 minutes, or until eggs are firm.

Fish Tacos.originalString: 1 pound cod fillets, cut into 2 to 3 ounce portions
Fish Tacos.name: cod fillets

Fish Tacos:
1. To make beer batter: In a large bowl, combine flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt. Blend egg and beer, then quickly stir into the flour mixture (don't worry about a few lumps).
  2. To make white sauce: In a medium bowl, mix together yogurt and mayonnaise. Gradually stir in fresh lime juice until consistency is slightly runny. Season with jalapeno, capers, oregano, cumin, dill, and cayenne.
  3. Heat oil in deep-fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
  4. Dust fish pieces lightly with flour. Dip into beer batter, and fry until crisp and golden brown.
  5. Drain on paper towels. Lightly fry tortillas; not too crisp. To serve, place fried fish in a tortilla, and top with shredded cabbage, and white sauce.
Baked Stuffed Brie with Cranberries & Wa:
1. Score the side of a wheel of brie all the way around with a sharp paring knife.
  2. Cut directly on the "equator" through the rind. Using a long piece of string or dental floss, wrap the string around the brie on the newly made cut. Loop one end of the string over the other (a half knot). Then pulling the ends of the string in opposite directions, cut the brie in half.
  3. Press the dried cranberries on one cut side of the brie, and the walnuts on the other. Quickly put the 2 sides back together with the cranberries on top of the walnuts. Press together and stuff back in any cranberries or walnuts that fell out.
  4. Roll out a thawed sheet of puff pastry on a floured surface to about 1/8-inch thickness.
  5. Place brie in center of pastry. Gently pull up edges to ensure you have enough dough to entirely wrap the brie. You can trim off the corners if there is too much dough.
  6. Brush the dough with the egg wash. Fold one edge of the dough over the brie and then the opposite side. Fold over the remaining edges and complexly encase the brie. You can trim off excess pieces of dough, if necessary. Flip the brie over so the seam is at the bottom; gently press in the sides to snug the dough against the brie.
  7. Brush the top and sides of the wrapped brie with egg wash.
  8. If you choose to decorate the brie with cut-out shapes of additional puff pastry, use very cold (almost still frozen) dough to ensure sharp lines. Lightly brush the decorative pieces with egg wash.
  9. Place the brie in the freezer for one hour (this is a crucial step; see note below).
  10. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
  11. Place the brie on the prepared baking sheet.
  12. Bake on the center rack in preheated oven until it is browned and leaking cheese, about 20 minutes. (Only rarely does the brie not leak through, but 20 to 25 minutes is about how long it takes to melt the cheese and brown the pastry.)
German Potato Pancakes:
1. In a large bowl, beat together eggs, flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper.
  2. Mix in potatoes and onion.
  3. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. In batches, drop heaping tablespoonfuls of the potato mixture into the skillet. Press to flatten. Cook about 3 minutes on each side, until browned and crisp.
  4. Drain on paper towels.
Guacamole:
1. In a medium bowl, mash together the avocados, lime juice, and salt.
  2. Mix in onion, cilantro, tomatoes, and garlic. Stir in cayenne pepper. Refrigerate 1 hour for best flavor, or serve immediately.
Cocktail Meatballs:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, egg, water, bread crumbs, and minced onion.
  3. Roll into small meatballs.
  4. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, turning once.
  5. In a slow cooker or large saucepan over low heat, blend the cranberry sauce, chili sauce, brown sugar, and lemon juice.
  6. Add meatballs, and simmer for 1 hour before serving.

Simple Italian Omelet.originalString: 1 tablespoon crumbled goat cheese, or to taste
Simple Italian Omelet.name: goat cheese

Simple Italian Omelet.originalString: 2 teaspoons chopped chives, divided, or to taste
Simple Italian Omelet.name: chives

Simple Italian Omelet.originalString: sea salt and ground black pepper to taste
Simple Italian Omelet.name: sea-salt

Simple Italian Omelet:
1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat, swirling oil to coat the skillet.
  2. Pour eggs into hot skillet; eggs will bubble and firm immediately.
  3. Lift cooked edges of the omelet with a rubber spatula and tilt the skillet so that the uncooked egg runs underneath the lifted edge. Continue cooking, lifting edges and tilting the skillet, until omelet is almost completely set, 1 to 2 minutes total cooking time; remove from heat.
  4. Spread out any runny egg evenly on the top of the omelet with a rubber spatula.
  5. Sprinkle goat cheese, 1 1/2 teaspoons chives, sea salt, and black pepper over omelet. Gently lift one edge and fold 1/3 of the omelet into the center over the cheese and chives. Fold the opposite 1/3 of the omelet into the center. Slide omelet to the edge of the skillet and flip, folded side down, onto a plate. Top with remaining chives.
Ham and Cheese Omelet Casserole:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Beat eggs in a large bowl, making sure that they are mixed very well and have a 'frothy' top.
  3. Add the milk, salt and pepper.
  4. Mix well. Stir in ham, then add cheese pieces and stir well.
  5. Pour mixture into a well greased 4 quart casserole dish and bake in the preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes or until top is lightly browned.
Marbled Pumpkin Cheesecake:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a medium bowl, mix together the crushed gingersnap cookies, pecans, and butter. Press into the bottom, and about 1 inch up the sides of a 9 inch springform pan.
  2. Bake crust 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Set aside to cool.
  3. In a medium bowl, mix together the cream cheese, 1/2 cup sugar, and vanilla just until smooth.
  4. Mix in eggs one at a time, blending well after each. Set aside 1 cup of the mixture. Blend 1/4 cup sugar, pumpkin, cinnamon, and nutmeg into the remaining mixture.
  5. Spread the pumpkin flavored batter into the crust, and drop the plain batter by spoonfuls onto the top. Swirl with a knife to create a marbled effect.
  6. Bake 55 minutes in the preheated oven, or until filling is set. Run a knife around the edge of the pan. Allow to cool before removing pan rim. Chill for at least 4 hours before serving.
Old Fashioned Cinnamon Nut Cake:
1. In a large bowl, mix together sour cream, 1/2 cup sugar, salt, and yeast. Stir until yeast dissolves.
  2. Add eggs, 1/2 cup melted butter, and half of the flour; mix well.
  3. Mix in the remaining flour.
  4. Turn dough out on floured board. Knead until smooth, about 10 to 15 minutes.
  5. Place in greased bowl, and cover.
  6. Let rise in warm place until double in bulk, about 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Punch dough down. Turn over, and let rise again for 45 minutes.
  7. Place 1/2 cup melted butter in a small cup.
  8. Mix together 1 cup white sugar, chopped nuts, and cinnamon. Form dough into walnut-sized balls. Dip each ball in melted butter, and roll in sugar-nut mixture.
  9. Place in layers in a 10 inch greased tube pan. Sprinkle any remaining sugar-nut mixture or melted butter over the top layer of balls. Cover pan with waxed paper and a towel, and let dough rise again 45 minutes.
  10. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 40 to 50 minutes, or until golden brown. Run a spatula around sides of cake, and invert onto plate.

Chicken Pot Pie IX.originalString: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cubed
Chicken Pot Pie IX.name: skinless boneless chicken breast halves

Chicken Pot Pie IX:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C.)
  2. In a saucepan, combine chicken, carrots, peas, and celery.
  3. Add water to cover and boil for 15 minutes.
  4. Remove from heat, drain and set aside.
  5. In the saucepan over medium heat, cook onions in butter until soft and translucent. Stir in flour, salt, pepper, and celery seed. Slowly stir in chicken broth and milk. Simmer over medium-low heat until thick.
  6. Remove from heat and set aside.
  7. Place the chicken mixture in bottom pie crust.
  8. Pour hot liquid mixture over. Cover with top crust, seal edges, and cut away excess dough. Make several small slits in the top to allow steam to escape.
  9. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Cool for 10 minutes before serving.
Three Egg Omelet:
1. Spray or lightly grease a large skillet and heat over medium heat.
  2. Crack 3 eggs into a glass measuring cup and beat with a fork or whisk until scrambled.
  3. Pour eggs into heated skillet, swirling the pan to coat the bottom. Cover and let cook until eggs are firm, about 2 minutes.
  4. Top with 1/4 each of the chopped ham, turkey, green onions, tomato, parsley, green bell pepper, and Cheddar cheese. Fold egg in half over fillings, and serve warm. Repeat with remaining ingredients for 4 omelets.
Paleo Omelet Muffins:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 8 muffin cups or line with paper liners.
  2. Beat eggs together in a large bowl.
  3. Mix ham, bell pepper, onion, salt, black pepper, and water into the beaten eggs.
  4. Pour egg mixture evenly into prepared muffin cups.
  5. Bake in the preheated oven until muffins are set in the middle, 18 to 20 minutes.

Slow Cooker Pulled Pork.originalString: 1 (18 ounce) bottle your favorite barbecue sauce
Slow Cooker Pulled Pork.name: barbecue sauce

Slow Cooker Pulled Pork.originalString: 8 hamburger buns, split and lightly toasted
Slow Cooker Pulled Pork.name: hamburger buns

Slow Cooker Pulled Pork.originalString: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle root beer
Slow Cooker Pulled Pork.name: root beer

Slow Cooker Pulled Pork:
1. Place the pork tenderloin in a slow cooker; pour the root beer over the meat. Cover and cook on low until well cooked and the pork shreds easily, 6 to 7 hours. Note: the actual length of time may vary according to individual slow cooker.
  2. Drain well. Stir in barbecue sauce.
  3. Serve over hamburger buns.
Quick and Easy Home Fries:
1. Rinse potato cubes with cold water, and drain well. Melt butter or margarine in a large skillet over medium heat.
  2. Place potatoes in the skillet, and stir to coat with butter. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with a lid, and cook for 10 minutes.
  3. Remove the lid, and cook for another 10 minutes, turning frequently until brown and crisp on all sides..

Brown Sugar Meatloaf.originalString: 3/4 cup finely crushed saltine cracker crumbs
Brown Sugar Meatloaf.name: cracker crumbs

Brown Sugar Meatloaf:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 5x9 inch loaf pan.
  2. Press the brown sugar in the bottom of the prepared loaf pan and spread the ketchup over the sugar.
  3. In a mixing bowl, mix thoroughly all remaining ingredients and shape into a loaf.
  4. Place on top of the ketchup.
  5. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour or until juices are clear.

Smoked Paprika Goulash for the Slow Cook.originalString: 3 pounds lean beef stew meat, cut into 1-inch cubes
Smoked Paprika Goulash for the Slow Cook.name: beef stew meat

Smoked Paprika Goulash for the Slow Cook:
1. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir onions until they soften and begin to brown at the edges, 8 to 10 minutes.
  2. Add the garlic and cook for one minute.
  3. Transfer mixture to a slow cooker. Cover and set cooker to Low.
  4. Mix together paprika, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Toss the meat cubes in the paprika mixture until evenly coated.
  5. Heat one tablespoon of the oil in the skillet over medium-high heat. Put a third of the beef cubes into the skillet and cook until nicely browned on all sides.
  6. Transfer to the slow cooker.
  7. Pour 2 tablespoons of water into the skillet and scrape the browned bits from the pan; pour liquid into the slow cooker. This prevents the paprika from burning when you brown the next batches of beef.
  8. Add another tablespoon of oil to the skillet and cook the next batch the same way; repeat for the third batch.
  9. Stir the tomato paste and the rest of the water into the slow cooker; cover. Cook on High for 4 to 5 hours (or on Low for 6 to 9 hours).
  10. Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Stir in the egg noodles, and cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the noodles have cooked through, but are still firm to the bite, about 5 minutes.
  11. Drain.
  12. Serve goulash over noodles with a dollop of sour cream and a sprig of parsley.
Mexican Rice II:
1. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat and add rice. Cook, stirring constantly, until puffed and golden. While rice is cooking, sprinkle with salt and cumin.
  2. Stir in onions and cook until tender. Stir in tomato sauce and chicken broth; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
Hummus III:
1. Place the garbanzo beans, tahini, lemon juice, salt and garlic in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth.
  2. Transfer mixture to a serving bowl.
  3. Drizzle olive oil over the garbanzo bean mixture. Sprinkle with paprika and parsley.
Cornish Game Hens with Garlic and Rosema:
1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
  2. Rub hens with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Lightly season hens with salt and pepper.
  3. Place 1 lemon wedge and 1 sprig rosemary in cavity of each hen. Arrange in a large, heavy roasting pan, and arrange garlic cloves around hens. Roast in preheated oven for 25 minutes.
  4. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a mixing bowl, whisk together wine, chicken broth, and remaining 2 tablespoons of oil; pour over hens. Continue roasting about 25 minutes longer, or until hens are golden brown and juices run clear. Baste with pan juices every 10 minutes.
  5. Transfer hens to a platter, pouring any cavity juices into the roasting pan. Tent hens with aluminum foil to keep warm.
  6. Transfer pan juices and garlic cloves to a medium saucepan and boil until liquids reduce to a sauce consistency, about 6 minutes.
  7. Cut hens in half lengthwise and arrange on plates. Spoon sauce and garlic around hens.
  8. Garnish with rosemary sprigs, and serve.
Pumpkin Pancakes:
1. In a bowl, mix together the milk, pumpkin, egg, oil and vinegar.
  2. Combine the flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, allspice, cinnamon, ginger and salt in a separate bowl. Stir into the pumpkin mixture just enough to combine.
  3. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat.
  4. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake. Brown on both sides and serve hot.
Roast Sticky Chicken-Rotisserie Style:
1. In a small bowl, mix together salt, paprika, onion powder, thyme, white pepper, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and garlic powder.
  2. Remove and discard giblets from chicken. Rinse chicken cavity, and pat dry with paper towel. Rub each chicken inside and out with spice mixture.
  3. Place 1 onion into the cavity of each chicken.
  4. Place chickens in a resealable bag or double wrap with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight, or at least 4 to 6 hours.
  5. Preheat oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).
  6. Place chickens in a roasting pan.
  7. Bake uncovered for 5 hours, to a minimum internal temperature of 180 degrees F (85 degrees C).
  8. Let the chickens stand for 10 minutes before carving.

Asiago Hash Browns.originalString: 1 (30 ounce) package frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
Asiago Hash Browns.name: hash brown potatoes

Asiago Hash Browns:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. In a medium casserole dish, mix the hash browns, Asiago cheese, onion, sour cream, heavy cream, and butter.
  3. Bake 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until hash browns are fully cooked and the top is lightly browned. Season with paprika, salt, and pepper.
Potato Cake:
1. In a medium size mixing bowl combine mashed potatoes, egg, flour, salt (if needed) and garlic salt.
  2. Mix well.
  3. Melt butter in a large frying pan over a low heat. Drop pancake-size (4 inch circles) lumps of mashed potatoes into the frying pan. Pat to flatten to 1/2 to 1 inch thickness. Sprinkle some cheddar cheese onto the mashed potato cake. Spoon more potato mixture over the cheese. Flip the potato cake over when the bottom is browned (about 10 minutes). Brown the other side (about 10 minutes).

Apple Crisp Cups.originalString: 3 large McIntosh apples - peeled, cored, and chopped
Apple Crisp Cups.name: apples

Apple Crisp Cups.originalString: 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, or to taste
Apple Crisp Cups.name: ground cinnamon

Apple Crisp Cups:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 4 12-cup mini-muffin tins.
  2. Mix apples, water, white sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon together in a saucepan, and bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally. Simmer until apples are partially cooked, about 5 minutes; remove from heat.
  3. Combine flour, oats, brown sugar, 1 teaspoon of cinnamon, and nutmeg in a large bowl; cut the butter into the flour mixture with a pastry cutter until the mixture looks like coarse crumbs.
  4. Place a heaping tablespoon of the crust mixture into a mini muffin cup, and press it into the cup so that it covers the bottom and pushes up the sides of the cup. Make the crust go all the way to the top of the little muffin cup, and patch any holes with more crust mixture. There will be crust mixture left over.
  5. Place about 2 teaspoons of apple filling in the crust. Sprinkle about 1 teaspoon of the remaining crust mixture on the filling.
  6. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes.
Banana Sour Cream Bread:
1. Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Grease four 7x3 inch loaf pans. In a small bowl, stir together 1/4 cup white sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon. Dust pans lightly with cinnamon and sugar mixture.
  2. In a large bowl, cream butter and 3 cups sugar.
  3. Mix in eggs, mashed bananas, sour cream, vanilla and cinnamon.
  4. Mix in salt, baking soda and flour. Stir in nuts. Divide into prepared pans.
  5. Bake for 1 hour, until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Tater Tot Casserole I:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Place sausage in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown.
  3. Drain, and spread evenly in the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan.
  4. Spread cheese over sausage.
  5. In large bowl, beat together milk and eggs.
  6. Pour over cheese. (May be refrigerated overnight at this point).Top with tater tots.
  7. Bake in preheated oven for 35 to 45 minutes. Cool for 5 to 10 minutes before serving.

Slow Cooker French Onion Soup.originalString: 4 large yellow onions, sliced and separated into rings
Slow Cooker French Onion Soup.name: yellow onions

Slow Cooker French Onion Soup.originalString: 1 teaspoon sea salt, or to taste
Slow Cooker French Onion Soup.name: sea salt

Slow Cooker French Onion Soup:
1. Heat butter in a large, heavy pot over medium-high heat; cook and stir onions until they become translucent, about 10 minutes. Sprinkle onions with sugar; reduce heat to medium. Cook, stirring constantly, until onions are soft and browned, at least 30 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
  2. Stir sherry into onion mixture and scrape bottom of pot to dissolve small bits of browned food from the pot.
  3. Transfer onions into a slow cooker and pour in beef broth. Season to taste with sea salt; stir in thyme and bay leaf. Cover cooker, set on High, and cook 4 to 6 hours. If desired, set on Low and cook 8 to 10 hours.
  4. About 10 minutes before serving, set oven rack about 8 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Arrange bread slices on a baking sheet.
  5. Broil bread slices until toasted, 1 to 2 minutes per side.
  6. Combine Gruyere, Emmental, Parmesan, and mozzarella cheeses in a bowl, tossing lightly. Fill oven-safe soup crocks 3/4 full of onion soup and float a bread slice in each bowl. Top with about 2 tablespoons of cheese mixture per serving.
  7. Place filled bowls onto a baking sheet and broil until cheese topping is lightly browned and bubbling, about 2 minutes.

Aunt Ro's Baked Beans.originalString: 2 (12 ounce) cans pinto beans, drained and rinsed
Aunt Ro's Baked Beans.name: canned pinto beans

Aunt Ro's Baked Beans.originalString: 2 (15.5 ounce) cans canned butter beans, drained and rinsed
Aunt Ro's Baked Beans.name: canned butter beans

Aunt Ro's Baked Beans.originalString: 2 (15 ounce) cans canned baked beans with pork
Aunt Ro's Baked Beans.name: baked beans

Aunt Ro's Baked Beans:
1. Place the bacon in a large, deep skillet and cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown.
  2. Drain on paper towels, crumble, and set aside.
  3. Drain bacon fat from the skillet.
  4. Using the same skillet, cook the ground beef and onion over medium heat, stirring until the meat is no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes.
  5. Drain.
  6. Transfer the ground beef to a slow cooker.
  7. Add the pinto beans, butter beans, baked beans with pork, barbeque sauce, ketchup, and brown sugar to the ground beef mixture; stir to blend well. Cover and cook for 4 hours on High. Top each serving with crumbled bacon.
Old Fashioned Tea Cakes I:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C). Grease a shallow (or, tea cake) pan.
  2. Cream butter; gradually add sugar and beat until fluffy.
  3. Add whole egg and egg yolk one at a time and beat until mixture is puffy light.
  4. Measure molasses into milk.
  5. Add vanilla. Sift dry ingredients.
  6. Add dry ingredients and liquid alternately to first mixture, mixing until smooth.
  7. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Frost with your favorite confectioner's icing.
  8. Cut into 1 x 2 inch slices.
Make-Ahead Baked Egg Sandwiches:
1. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
  2. Pour the beaten eggs into the prepared baking dish.
  3. Bake in the preheated oven until they set and are no longer runny, 8 to 10 minutes.
  4. Remove, allow to cool, and cut into 6 portions.
  5. Butter the cut sides of the croissants and place one portion of the cooked egg onto each croissant bottom. Top each sandwich with two slices of ham and a slice of Colby-Jack cheese.
  6. Place the croissant tops on top of the sandwiches; wrap each sandwich well with plastic wrap.
  7. Place the sandwiches onto a baking sheet; freeze until solid, about 3 hours. Store frozen.
  8. To reheat, cook a wrapped sandwich in a microwave on High until hot in the center, 1 to 2 minutes.

Chicken Breasts Pierre.originalString: 1 (14.5 ounce) can stewed tomatoes, with liquid
Chicken Breasts Pierre.name: canned tomatoes

Chicken Breasts Pierre:
1. In a shallow dish or bowl, combine flour, 1/2 teaspoon salt and ground black pepper. Coat chicken breasts with flour mixture. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat, and brown chicken on all sides.
  2. Remove from skillet, and drain on paper towels.
  3. In the same skillet, combine the tomatoes, water, brown sugar, vinegar and Worcestershire sauce. Season with salt, chili powder, mustard, celery seed, garlic and hot pepper sauce. Bring to a boil; reduce heat, and return chicken to skillet. Cover, and simmer for 35 to 40 minutes, or until chicken is tender, no longer pink and juices run clear.
Ham and Mushroom Baked Eggs:
1. Make the cheese sauce: Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a saucepan on top of the stove. Quickly stir the flour into the saucepan until the mixture is smooth. Stir in the milk, salt and pepper; continue stirring until the mixture is smooth and thick. Finally, stir in the cheese until it is melted.
  2. Grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.
  3. In a skillet, saute butter and onions.
  4. Pour the beaten eggs and ham into the skillet; scramble until set. Fold the mushrooms and cheese sauce into the eggs.
  5. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking pan. Cover and chill for 30 minutes or overnight.
  6. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  7. Bake the egg and mushroom casserole for 30 minutes in the 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) oven.

Sweet and Sour Meatballs.originalString: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle chile sauce
Sweet and Sour Meatballs.name: chile garlic sauce

Sweet and Sour Meatballs:
1. Whisk together the chili sauce, lemon juice and grape jelly.
  2. Pour into slow cooker and simmer over low heat until warm.
  3. Combine ground beef, egg, onion and salt.
  4. Mix well and form into 1 inch balls.
  5. Add to sauce and simmer for 1 1/2 hours.

Easy Masala Hash Browns.originalString: 4 potatoes, peeled and cut into 2-inch pieces
Easy Masala Hash Browns.name: potatoes

Easy Masala Hash Browns:
1. Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
  2. Combine oil, garam masala, and seasoned salt together in a large bowl.
  3. Add potato pieces and toss to coat.
  4. Spread on an ungreased baking sheet.
  5. Broil potatoes in the preheated oven until starting to brown, about 7 minutes.
  6. Remove from oven and flip potatoes over. Return to the oven and continue broiling until golden brown, about 5 minutes more.
Alaska Salmon Bake with Pecan Crunch Coa:
1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a small bowl, mix together the mustard, butter, and honey. In another bowl, mix together the bread crumbs, pecans, and parsley.
  2. Season each salmon fillet with salt and pepper.
  3. Place on a lightly greased baking sheet.
  4. Brush with mustard-honey mixture. Cover the top of each fillet with bread crumb mixture.
  5. Bake for 10 minutes per inch of thickness, measured at thickest part, or until salmon just flakes when tested with a fork.
  6. Serve garnished with lemon wedges.

Bacon & Egg Biscuit Cups.originalString: 1/2 cup Borden® Cheddar and Monterey Jack Shreds
Bacon & Egg Biscuit Cups.name: monterey jack

Bacon & Egg Biscuit Cups.originalString: 3 tablespoons Borden® Cheddar and Monterey Jack Shreds, for topping
Bacon & Egg Biscuit Cups.name: monterey jack

Bacon & Egg Biscuit Cups:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
  3. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Crumble or chop into small pieces.
  4. Separate 6 biscuits into 2 rounds each. Press rounds into 12 cups of a muffin tin, pressing up sides to form biscuit dough cups.
  5. Mix eggs, bacon pieces, and 1/2 cup shredded cheese together in a bowl.
  6. Fill muffin pan biscuits with egg mixture about 3/4 full. Sprinkle remaining 3 tablespoons cheese on top.
  7. Bake in preheated oven until egg mixture is set, 18 to 22 minutes.
  8. Let cool 5 minutes before serving.

Curried Coconut Chicken.originalString: 2 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1/2-inch chunks
Curried Coconut Chicken.name: skinless boneless chicken breasts

Curried Coconut Chicken.originalString: 1 teaspoon salt and pepper, or to taste
Curried Coconut Chicken.name: salt and pepper

Curried Coconut Chicken:
1. Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper.
  2. Heat oil and curry powder in a large skillet over medium-high heat for two minutes. Stir in onions and garlic, and cook 1 minute more.
  3. Add chicken, tossing lightly to coat with curry oil. Reduce heat to medium, and cook for 7 to 10 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink in center and juices run clear.
  4. Pour coconut milk, tomatoes, tomato sauce, and sugar into the pan, and stir to combine. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, approximately 30 to 40 minutes.
Amish Hash Browns:
1. In a large bowl, mix together the flour, cornmeal, salt and baking powder.
  2. Add potatoes, 1/3 cup of oil, eggs and onion and mix until evenly blended.
  3. Heat 1/4 cup of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drop heaping tablespoons of the potatoes into the hot oil, flattening slightly. Cook until browned on the bottom and then flip and cook on the other side. Keep in a warm oven while frying the rest.

Oven Omelet.originalString: 1 to taste salt and pepper to taste
Oven Omelet.name: salt and pepper

Oven Omelet:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8x8 inch glass baking dish.
  2. Beat eggs in a large bowl; stir in the milk. Stir in the potatoes, ham and cheese. Season to taste and pour into prepared pan.
  3. Bake in preheated oven for 45 to 50, until knife inserted in middle comes out clean.

Chicken Marsala.originalString: 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - pounded 1/4 inch thick
Chicken Marsala.name: chicken breast halves

Chicken Marsala:
1. In a shallow dish or bowl, mix together the flour, salt, pepper and oregano. Coat chicken pieces in flour mixture.
  2. In a large skillet, melt butter in oil over medium heat.
  3. Place chicken in the pan, and lightly brown. Turn over chicken pieces, and add mushrooms.
  4. Pour in wine and sherry. Cover skillet; simmer chicken 10 minutes, turning once, until no longer pink and juices run clear.

Sweet, Sticky and Spicy Chicken.originalString: 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1/2 inch strips
Sweet, Sticky and Spicy Chicken.name: skinless boneless chicken breast halves

Sweet, Sticky and Spicy Chicken:
1. Mix together brown sugar, honey, soy sauce, ginger, garlic and hot sauce in a small bowl.
  2. Lightly salt and pepper the chicken strips.
  3. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
  4. Add chicken strips and brown on both sides, about 1 minute per side.
  5. Pour the sauce over the chicken. Simmer uncovered until the sauce thickens, 8 to 10 minutes.
Garlicky Appetizer Shrimp Scampi:
1. Preheat grill for high heat.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together softened butter, olive oil, garlic, shallots, chives, salt, pepper, and paprika; add the shrimp, and toss to coat.
  3. Lightly oil grill grate. Cook the shrimp as close to the flame as possible for 2 to 3 minutes per side, or until opaque.
Seasoned Swai Fish Fillet:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a shallow pan or baking sheet with cooking spray.
  2. Place fish fillets into the prepared pan.
  3. Heat margarine in a saucepan over medium heat.
  4. Mix white wine, lemon juice, cilantro, garlic, salt, and black pepper into the melted margarine; simmer sauce for 2 minutes. Generously spoon sauce over fish fillets. Sprinkle fillets with paprika.
  5. Bake in the preheated oven until fish flakes easily with a fork, 10 to 12 minutes.
Playgroup Granola Bars:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Generously grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, brown sugar, wheat germ, cinnamon, flour, raisins and salt. Make a well in the center, and pour in the honey, egg, oil and vanilla.
  3. Mix well using your hands. Pat the mixture evenly into the prepared pan.
  4. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes in the preheated oven, until the bars begin to turn golden at the edges. Cool for 5 minutes, then cut into bars while still warm. Do not allow the bars to cool completely before cutting, or they will be too hard to cut.

Orange and Milk-Braised Pork Carnitas.originalString: 3 1/2 pounds boneless pork shoulder, cut into large pieces
Orange and Milk-Braised Pork Carnitas.name: boneless pork shoulder

Orange and Milk-Braised Pork Carnitas.originalString: 1 tablespoon kosher salt, or more to taste
Orange and Milk-Braised Pork Carnitas.name: kosher salt

Orange and Milk-Braised Pork Carnitas:
1. Season pork with pepper and salt.
  2. Heat oil in large pot over high heat. Working in batches, cook pork in the hot oil until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes. Return all cooked pork and accumulated juice to pot.
  3. Season pork with bay leaves, cumin, dried oregano, and cayenne pepper. Stir in fresh orange juice, orange zest, and milk. Bring mixture to a boil over high heat; reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, until meat is fork tender but not falling apart, about 2 hours.
  4. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
  5. Remove pork from liquid. Skim some fat from the pot to grease a baking dish.
  6. Transfer the pieces of pork to the baking dish.
  7. Drizzle about 2 more tablespoons of the floating fat over the meat. Season with more salt, if needed.
  8. Bake in preheated oven until pork is browned, about 15 minutes. Stir pork.
  9. Turn on oven's broiler. Cook pork under broiler until crisp, 2 to 3 minutes.
Soft Oatmeal Cookies:
1. In a medium bowl, cream together butter, white sugar, and brown sugar. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
  2. Combine flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon; stir into the creamed mixture.
  3. Mix in oats. Cover, and chill dough for at least one hour.
  4. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets.
  5. Roll the dough into walnut sized balls, and place 2 inches apart on cookie sheets. Flatten each cookie with a large fork dipped in sugar.
  6. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Eggs Benedict Casserole.originalString: 3/4 pound Canadian bacon, cut into 1/2-inch dice
Eggs Benedict Casserole.name: canadian bacon

Eggs Benedict Casserole:
1. Spray 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
  2. Whisk eggs, 2 cups milk, green onions, onion powder, and salt together in a large bowl until well mixed.
  3. Layer half the Canadian bacon in the prepared baking dish.
  4. Spread English muffins over meat and top with remaining Canadian bacon.
  5. Pour egg mixture over casserole. Cover baking dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
  6. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
  7. Sprinkle casserole with paprika; cover with aluminum foil.
  8. Bake in preheated oven until eggs are nearly set, about 30 minutes; remove foil. Continue baking until eggs are completely set, about 15 more minutes.
  9. Whisk hollandaise sauce mix with 1 cup milk in a saucepan.
  10. Add margarine and bring to a boil, stirring frequently. Reduce heat to medium-low, simmer, and stir until thickened, about 1 minute.
  11. Drizzle sauce over casserole to serve.

Jennifer's Burgundy Beef Stew.originalString: 1 1/2 pounds London broil-cut beef, cut into chunks
Jennifer's Burgundy Beef Stew.name: london broil

Jennifer's Burgundy Beef Stew.originalString: 1 pinch ground black pepper, or to taste
Jennifer's Burgundy Beef Stew.name: ground pepper

Jennifer's Burgundy Beef Stew:
1. Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
  2. Remove bacon to a paper towel, retaining drippings in the skillet.
  3. Pour olive oil into reserved bacon drippings.
  4. Pour flour into a large sealable plastic bag; add the beef, seal, and shake to coat meat with flour. Cook and stir beef in the bacon drippings mixture until browned on all sides, 7 to 10 minutes.
  5. Crumble the bacon and add to the skillet.
  6. Pour beef stock and Burgundy wine over the beef mixture; bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the beef is tender, about 1 hour.
  7. Stir carrots, potatoes, mushrooms, garlic, onion, marjoram, thyme, seasoned salt, salt, and black pepper into the beef mixture; continue cooking at a simmer until the vegetables are tender, 20 to 30 minutes.

Mom's Scalloped Potatoes.originalString: salt and ground black pepper to taste
Mom's Scalloped Potatoes.name: ground pepper

Mom's Scalloped Potatoes.originalString: 3 cups whole milk, or as needed
Mom's Scalloped Potatoes.name: whole milk

Mom's Scalloped Potatoes:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
  2. Spread about 1/3 of the potato slices into the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Top with about 1/3 of the onion slices. Sprinkle 3 tablespoons flour over the potato and onion. Arrange 2 tablespoons butter atop the flour. Season the entire layer with salt and pepper. Repeat layering twice more.
  3. Heat milk in a saucepan until warm.
  4. Pour enough warm milk over the mixture in the baking dish so the top of the liquid is level with the final layer of potatoes.
  5. Bake in preheated oven until potatoes are tender, 45 to 60 minutes.
Scrambled Egg Breakfast Casserole:
1. Melt 5 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
  2. Saute bacon crumbles and onion in hot butter until onion is tender, 5 to 10 minutes.
  3. Add eggs; cook and stir until eggs are starting to set but are still moist, about 5 minutes.
  4. Melt 5 tablespoons butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
  5. Whisk flour into butter to form a thick paste.
  6. Add milk, Cheddar cheese, salt, and pepper. Cook and stir until cheese is melted and sauce is thick, 5 to 7 minutes.
  7. Stir seasoned stuffing mix and 1/4 cup melted butter together in a bowl.
  8. Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
  9. Stir eggs and cheese sauce together in a bowl; pour into prepared baking dish and spread stuffing mixture over the top. Cover the baking dish with plastic wrap and chill in the refrigerator, 8 hours to overnight.
  10. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  11. Remove plastic wrap from baking dish.
  12. Bake casserole in the preheated oven until heated through and set, about 30 minutes.

Grandma's Green Bean Casserole.originalString: 3 (14.5 ounce) cans French style green beans, drained
Grandma's Green Bean Casserole.name: green beans

Grandma's Green Bean Casserole:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in flour until smooth, and cook for one minute. Stir in the salt, sugar, onion, and sour cream.
  3. Add green beans, and stir to coat.
  4. Transfer the mixture to a 2 1/2 quart casserole dish.
  5. Spread shredded cheese over the top. In a small bowl, toss together cracker crumbs and remaining butter, and sprinkle over the cheese.
  6. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the top is golden and cheese is bubbly.

Green Egg and Ham Cups.originalString: 1 leek, white and tender green part only, thinly sliced
Green Egg and Ham Cups.name: leek

Green Egg and Ham Cups:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12 cup muffin pan.
  2. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in the leek, green onion, and salt and pepper; cook until soft and tender.
  3. Pour in the beef broth; whisk in the flour. Simmer until mixture becomes creamy and thick.
  4. Line each muffin cup with 1 slice of ham to form a cup. Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the leek mixture into the bottom of each ham cup. Top with a heaping tablespoon of cheese. Press the cheese down lightly with a spoon. Beat eggs and cream in a large bowl. Divide egg mixture evenly between the ham cups.
  5. Bake cups in the preheated oven until set and golden, about 12 to 15 minutes. Allow baked eggs to rest for at least 10 minutes in muffin cups.
  6. Remove by gently pulling on the crisped ham edge and lifting up.
  7. Serve immediately or refrigerate.
Apricot Brown Sugar Ham:
1. Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).
  2. Place the ham cut side down onto a sheet of aluminum foil. I like to put the shiny side up.
  3. Mix together the brown sugar, apricot jam and mustard powder in a small bowl.
  4. Brush onto the ham using a pastry or barbeque brush. Reserve any leftover glaze. Enclose the foil around the ham and place on a rimmed baking sheet.
  5. Roast for 2 hours in the preheated oven, or if your ham is a different size, figure 14 minutes per pound. Apply the remaining glaze 20 minutes before the ham is done.

Roasted New Red Potatoes.originalString: 3 pounds small red new potatoes, halved
Roasted New Red Potatoes.name: new potatoes

Roasted New Red Potatoes.originalString: 1 teaspoon Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Roasted New Red Potatoes.name: salt and pepper

Roasted New Red Potatoes:
1. Adjust oven rack to lowest position and heat oven to 450 degrees. Toss potatoes with oil, salt and pepper. Arrange, cut side down, on a large lipped cookie sheet or jellyroll pan.
  2. Roast until tender and golden brown, about 30 minutes (check after 20 minutes).
  3. Transfer to a serving dish.

Slow Cooker Beef Pot Roast.originalString: 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, or as needed
Slow Cooker Beef Pot Roast.name: flour

Slow Cooker Beef Pot Roast:
1. Generously season both sides of roast with salt and pepper. Sprinkle flour over the top until well coated, and pat it into the meat. Shake off any excess.
  2. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Sear the roast on both sides for 5-6 minutes each, until well browned.
  3. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
  4. Reduce the heat to medium and stir in mushrooms and butter; cook for 3-4 minutes.
  5. Stir in onion; cook for 5 minutes, until onions are translucent and begin to brown.
  6. Add garlic, stir for about a minute.
  7. Stir in 1 1/2 tablespoons flour; cook and stir for about 1 minute.
  8. Add tomato paste, and cook for another minute.
  9. Slowly add chicken stock, stir to combine, and return to a simmer.
  10. Remove skillet from the heat.
  11. Place carrots and celery in the slow cooker.
  12. Place roast over the vegetables and pour in any accumulated juices.
  13. Add rosemary and thyme.
  14. Pour onion and mushroom mixture over the top of the roast. Cover slow cooker, turn to high and cook the roast for 5-6 hours, until the meat is fork tender.
  15. Skim off any fat from the surface and remove the bones. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Hot Artichoke and Crab Dip:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Combine cream cheese and mayonnaise in a large bowl until smooth; stir in garlic. Gently stir artichoke hearts, crab, Parmesan cheese, 1/3 cup green onion, 1/3 cup red bell pepper, and cayenne pepper into cream cheese mixture.
  3. Transfer the dip to a 9-inch pie dish and sprinkle top with bread crumbs.
  4. Bake in the preheated oven until crumb topping is golden brown and dip is hot, 20 to 30 minutes.
  5. Garnish with 2 teaspoons green onion and 2 teaspoons chopped red bell pepper.
Mussels Mariniere:
1. Scrub mussels. Pull off beards, the tuft of fibers that attach each mussel to it's shell, cutting them at the base with a paring knife. Discard those that do not close when you handle them and any with broken shells. Set aside.
  2. Combine onion, garlic, 4 tablespoons parsley, bay leaf, thyme, wine, and 2 tablespoons butter in large pot. Bring to boil. Lower heat, and cook 2 minutes.
  3. Add mussels, and cover. Cook just until shells open, 3 to 4 minutes. Do not overcook.
  4. Remove mussels from sauce, and place in bowls.
  5. Strain liquid, and return to pot.
  6. Add remaining butter and parsley.
  7. Heat until butter melts.
  8. Pour over mussels.
Ham and Cheese Breakfast Tortillas:
1. Beat together eggs and milk.
  2. Heat a lightly oiled skillet (or non-stick pan) over medium high heat and cook egg mixture, stirring occasionally, until firm. When almost done, stir in ham, green onions, salt and pepper.
  3. Spoon 1/4 of the egg mixture on top of each tortilla. Sprinkle the eggs with cheese, fold over the tortilla to make a roll and top with salsa if desired.

Mom's Fabulous Chicken Pot Pie with Bisc.originalString: salt and ground black pepper to taste
Mom's Fabulous Chicken Pot Pie with Bisc.name: ground pepper

Mom's Fabulous Chicken Pot Pie with Bisc.originalString: 3 cups cooked chicken, cut into bite-size pieces
Mom's Fabulous Chicken Pot Pie with Bisc.name: cooked chicken

Mom's Fabulous Chicken Pot Pie with Bisc.originalString: 1 (16.3 ounce) can refrigerated flaky-style biscuits (such as Pillsbury Grands®)
Mom's Fabulous Chicken Pot Pie with Bisc.name: biscuits

Mom's Fabulous Chicken Pot Pie with Bisc:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Melt butter in a skillet over medium-low heat, and cook the onion, celery, and carrots until the celery and carrots are tender, about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in peas, parsley, thyme and flour, and cook, stirring constantly, until the flour coats the vegetables and begins to fry, about 5 minutes.
  3. Whisk in chicken broth and half-and-half, and cook until the sauce is thick and bubbling. Season to taste with salt and black pepper, and mix in the chicken meat.
  4. Transfer the chicken, vegetables, and sauce into a 2-quart baking dish. Arrange biscuits on top of the filling. In a small bowl, beat egg yolk with water; brush egg yolk on the biscuits.
  5. Bake in the preheated oven until the biscuits are golden brown and the pie filling is bubbling, 20 to 25 minutes.
  6. Let rest 10 minutes before serving.
Peppered Shrimp Alfredo:
1. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
  2. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
  3. Meanwhile, melt butter together with the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir in onion, and cook until softened and translucent, about 2 minutes. Stir in garlic, red pepper, and mushroom; cook over medium-high heat until soft, about 2 minutes more.
  4. Stir in the shrimp, and cook until firm and pink, then pour in Alfredo sauce, Romano cheese, and cream; bring to a simmer stirring constantly until thickened, about 5 minutes. Season with cayenne, salt, and pepper to taste. Stir drained pasta into the sauce, and serve sprinkled with chopped parsley.

Herbed Scalloped Potatoes and Onions.originalString: 5 large potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
Herbed Scalloped Potatoes and Onions.name: potatoes

Herbed Scalloped Potatoes and Onions:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease a 2 1/2-quart baking dish.
  2. Layer potatoes and onion in prepared baking dish.
  3. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; stir in flour until smooth. Gradually add broth, mayonnaise, garlic, salt, parsley, poultry seasoning, and pepper; cook and stir until thick and bubbly, about 2 minutes.
  4. Pour mayonnaise mixture over potatoes and onion. Cover baking dish with aluminum foil.
  5. Bake in preheated oven until potatoes are tender, about 1 hour 45 minutes.
  6. Remove foil and continue to bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes more. Sprinkle with chives to serve.
Omelet in a Bag:
1. Crack the eggs into a large resealable freezer bag. Press out most of the air, and seal. Shake or squeeze to beat the eggs. Open the bag, and add the ham, cheese, onion, green pepper, tomato, salsa, and mushrooms. Squeeze out as much of the air as you can, and seal the bag.
  2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
  3. Place up to 8 bags at a time into the boiling water. Cook for exactly 13 minutes. Open the bag, and let the omelet roll out onto a plate. The omelet should roll out easily.

Omelet in a Mug.originalString: salt and ground black pepper to taste
Omelet in a Mug.name: ground pepper

Omelet in a Mug:
1. Combine egg, egg whites, Cheddar cheese, ham, bell pepper, salt, and ground pepper in a microwave-safe mug coated with non-stick spray.
  2. Microwave on high for 1 minute; stir. Return to microwave and cook until eggs are completely set, 1 to 1 1/2 minutes longer.
Charleston Breakfast Casserole:
1. Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown.
  2. Drain, crumble and set aside.
  3. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
  4. Melt butter in the microwave, or in a small pan on the stove over low heat. Spray a 9x12 inch baking dish with vegetable spray.
  5. Place croutons in the bottom of the dish, and drizzle with melted butter. Sprinkle with grated Cheddar cheese.
  6. Crack the eggs into a bowl, whisking to break up the yolks.
  7. Add milk, peppers, mustard, salt, and pepper, and beat until well-combined.
  8. Pour over the croutons and cheese, and sprinkle with crumbled bacon.
  9. Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes.
  10. Remove from oven and allow to stand 10 minutes before serving.
Artichoke & Spinach Dip Restaurant Style:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Place garlic in a small baking dish.
  3. Bake in the preheated oven 20 to 30 minutes, until soft.
  4. Remove from heat. When cool enough to touch, squeeze softened garlic from skins.
  5. In an 8x8 inch baking dish, spread the roasted garlic, spinach, artichoke hearts, Alfredo-style pasta sauce, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, and cream cheese.
  6. Bake in the preheated oven 30 minutes, or until cheeses are melted and bubbly.
  7. Serve warm.

Ham and Cheese Egg Bake.originalString: 4 cups crustless white bread cubes (1-inch pieces)
Ham and Cheese Egg Bake.name: bread cubes

Ham and Cheese Egg Bake.originalString: 8 ounces Dietz & Watson sliced deli ham, coarsely chopped
Ham and Cheese Egg Bake.name: deli ham

Ham and Cheese Egg Bake.originalString: 2 1/2 cups American cheese, cut into thin strips
Ham and Cheese Egg Bake.name: american cheese

Ham and Cheese Egg Bake:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
  2. Grease a 2 quart baking dish. Layer the bread, ham, 2 cups cheese and 2 tablespoons chives in the dish.
  3. In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper.
  4. Pour into the dish and top with the tomato slices in an even layer.
  5. Bake the eggs until nearly set, about 30 minutes. Sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese and 1 tablespoon chives on top and bake until golden.
French Toast I:
1. Beat together egg, milk, salt, desired spices and vanilla.
  2. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
  3. Dunk each slice of bread in egg mixture, soaking both sides.
  4. Place in pan, and cook on both sides until golden.
  5. Serve hot.

Restaurant-Style Hashbrown Casserole.originalString: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
Restaurant-Style Hashbrown Casserole.name: condensed cream of chicken soup

Restaurant-Style Hashbrown Casserole.originalString: 1 (2 pound) package frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
Restaurant-Style Hashbrown Casserole.name: hash brown potatoes

Restaurant-Style Hashbrown Casserole:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray one 9x13 inch pan with non-stick cooking spray.
  2. In a large bowl, combine the potatoes, butter, salt, pepper, onions, soup and cheese. Gently mix and pour into prepared pan or dish.
  3. Bake in the preheated oven until browned, about 35 minutes.
World's Best Lasagna:
1. In a Dutch oven, cook sausage, ground beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until well browned. Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato sauce, and water. Season with sugar, basil, fennel seeds, Italian seasoning, 1 tablespoon salt, pepper, and 2 tablespoons parsley. Simmer, covered, for about 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.
  2. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook lasagna noodles in boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes.
  3. Drain noodles, and rinse with cold water. In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese with egg, remaining parsley, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
  4. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
  5. To assemble, spread 1 1/2 cups of meat sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Arrange 6 noodles lengthwise over meat sauce.
  6. Spread with one half of the ricotta cheese mixture. Top with a third of mozzarella cheese slices. Spoon 1 1/2 cups meat sauce over mozzarella, and sprinkle with 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Repeat layers, and top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. Cover with foil: to prevent sticking, either spray foil with cooking spray, or make sure the foil does not touch the cheese.
  7. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes.
  8. Remove foil, and bake an additional 25 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes before serving.

Spring Omelet.originalString: 3 spears asparagus, trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces
Spring Omelet.name: asparagus spears

Spring Omelet:
1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
  2. Add the asparagus, mushrooms and onions; cook and stir until the asparagus is fairly soft, about 4 minutes.
  3. Whisk together the eggs and milk in a small bowl; pour over the sauteed vegetables and reduce the heat to medium. While the omelet cooks, lift the edge to allow the uncooked egg to flow underneath. When most of the egg is cooked, sprinkle Parmesan cheese over the top. Allow the cheese to melt slightly, then fold in half and serve.
Yellow Squash Casserole:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
  2. Place squash and onion in a large skillet over medium heat.
  3. Pour in a small amount of water. Cover, and cook until squash is tender, about 5 minutes.
  4. Drain well, and place in a large bowl.
  5. In a medium bowl, mix together cracker crumbs and cheese. Stir half of the cracker mixture into the cooked squash and onions. In a small bowl, mix together eggs and milk, then add to squash mixture. Stir in 1/4 cup melted butter, and season with salt and pepper.
  6. Spread into a 9x13 inch baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining cracker mixture, and dot with 2 tablespoons butter.
  7. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes, or until lightly browned.

Pecan Sour Cream Coffee Cake.originalString: 1 cup sour cream or creme fraiche
Pecan Sour Cream Coffee Cake.name: creme fraiche

Pecan Sour Cream Coffee Cake:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter an 8-inch by 10-inch baking dish.
  2. Mix pecans, 1/3 cup white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt, and melted butter thoroughly in a mixing bowl until all components are coated with butter, 3 to 4 minutes.
  3. In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda.
  4. In another bowl, mix together butter and 1 cup sugar with a spatula until well blended.
  5. Add 1 egg and whisk until mixture is smooth, 2 to 3 minutes.
  6. Whisk in second egg until thoroughly incorporated.
  7. Add vanilla and sour cream; whisk together.
  8. Add flour mixture to wet ingredients; whisk until flour disappears (do not over mix).
  9. Spread one half of the batter evenly into the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Scatter one half of the crumb mixture evenly over the top of the batter. Top with the rest of the batter and spread carefully to evenly distribute, trying not to disturb the crumbs. Top with the rest of the crumb mixture. Very gently press crumbs into batter.
  10. Bake in preheated oven until a bamboo skewer comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes.
  11. Let cool slightly before serving.
Oven Baked Jambalaya:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Melt butter in large stock pot.
  3. Saute onion, green pepper, celery and garlic until tender, being careful not to burn the garlic.
  4. Add tomato paste and cook to brown slightly, stirring constantly. Stir in bay leaves, Creole seasoning blend and Worcestershire sauce.
  5. Pour into a large roasting pan. Squeeze tomatoes to break up into pieces, and add to mixture in pan. Stir in juice from tomatoes, chicken stock, ham, sausage, chicken, shrimp and rice.
  6. Mix well. Cover tightly with aluminum foil.
  7. Bake in preheated oven for 1 1/2 hours, stirring once halfway through baking time.
  8. Remove bay leaves before serving.
Country Style Fried Potatoes:
1. In a large cast iron skillet, heat shortening over medium-high heat.
  2. Add potatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are golden brown. Season with salt, pepper, garlic powder and paprika.
  3. Serve hot.

Slow Cooker Western Omelet.originalString: 1 (2 pound) package frozen shredded hash brown potatoes
Slow Cooker Western Omelet.name: hash brown potatoes

Slow Cooker Western Omelet.originalString: 1 green bell pepper, seeded and diced
Slow Cooker Western Omelet.name: green bell pepper

Slow Cooker Western Omelet:
1. Lightly grease a 4 quart or larger slow cooker.
  2. Place 1/3 of the hash brown potatoes in a layer on the bottom. Layer 1/3 of the ham, onion, green pepper, and Cheddar cheese. Repeat layers two more times. In a large bowl, whisk together eggs and milk, and season with salt and pepper.
  3. Pour over the contents of the slow cooker.
  4. Cover, and cook on Low for 10 to 12 hours.
Chicken in a Pot:
1. In a medium bowl, combine the broth, tomato paste, ground black pepper, oregano, salt and garlic.
  2. Mix well and set aside.
  3. Dredge the chicken in the bread crumbs, coating well.
  4. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat.
  5. Saute the chicken in the oil for 2 minutes per side, or until lightly browned.
  6. Add the reserved broth mixture and the mushrooms to the skillet and bring to a boil. Then cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes.
  7. Remove chicken and set aside, covering to keep it warm.
  8. Bring broth mixture to a boil and cook for 4 minutes, or until reduced to desired thickness. Spoon sauce over the chicken and serve.

Sausage Egg Casserole.originalString: 2 (4 ounce) cans diced green chile peppers, drained
Sausage Egg Casserole.name: green chile peppers

Sausage Egg Casserole:
1. Place sausage in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown.
  2. Drain, and set aside. Melt butter in skillet, and cook and stir the green onions and mushrooms until tender.
  3. In a large bowl, mix the eggs, cottage cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, and chiles. Stir in the sausage, green onions, and mushrooms. Cover, and refrigerate overnight.
  4. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
  5. In a bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Blend in the melted butter. Stir the flour mixture into the egg mixture.
  6. Pour into the prepared baking dish.
  7. Bake 40 to 50 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly brown.
  8. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Colleen's Slow Cooker Jambalaya.originalString: 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice
Colleen's Slow Cooker Jambalaya.name: canned tomatoes

Colleen's Slow Cooker Jambalaya.originalString: 1 pound frozen cooked shrimp without tails
Colleen's Slow Cooker Jambalaya.name: shrimp

Colleen's Slow Cooker Jambalaya.originalString: 1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1 inch cubes
Colleen's Slow Cooker Jambalaya.name: skinless boneless chicken breast halves

Colleen's Slow Cooker Jambalaya:
1. In a slow cooker, mix the chicken, sausage, tomatoes with juice, onion, green bell pepper, celery, and broth. Season with oregano, parsley, Cajun seasoning, cayenne pepper, and thyme.
  2. Cover, and cook 7 to 8 hours on Low, or 3 to 4 hours on High. Stir in the shrimp during the last 30 minutes of cook time.

Tilapia Scampi.originalString: 4 (6 ounce) tilapia fillets, rinsed and patted dry
Tilapia Scampi.name: tilapia fillets

Tilapia Scampi:
1. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C); prepare a baking dish with cooking spray.
  2. Combine the butter, lemon juice, and garlic in a microwave-safe bowl; heat in microwave in 10-second increments until the butter is completely melted and the garlic has softened, stirring between each session, about 1 minute total.
  3. Arrange the tilapia in the bottom of the prepared baking dish; pour the butter mixture over the fillets assuring they are all evenly covered. Sprinkle the parsley over the tilapia.
  4. Bake in the preheated oven, turning the fillets every 10 minutes, until the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 40 minutes total.
American Frittata:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
  2. Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 5 minutes.
  3. Drain and set aside to cool. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  4. In a cast iron skillet, heat oil over medium heat.
  5. Add onions and cook slowly, stirring occasionally, until onions are soft.
  6. Stir in eggs, drained potatoes, ham, salt and pepper. Cook until eggs are firm on the bottom, about 5 minutes. Top frittata with shredded cheese and place in preheated oven until cheese is melted and eggs are completely firm, about 10 minutes.

Slow Cooker Chicken Stroganoff.originalString: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
Slow Cooker Chicken Stroganoff.name: condensed cream of chicken soup

Slow Cooker Chicken Stroganoff.originalString: 1 (.7 ounce) package dry Italian-style salad dressing mix
Slow Cooker Chicken Stroganoff.name: ranch salad dressing mix

Slow Cooker Chicken Stroganoff.originalString: 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cubed
Slow Cooker Chicken Stroganoff.name: skinless boneless chicken breast halves

Slow Cooker Chicken Stroganoff:
1. Put chicken, margarine and dressing mix in slow cooker; mix together and cook on low for 5 to 6 hours.
  2. Add cream cheese and soup, mix together and cook on high for another 1/2 hour or until heated through and warm.
Szechwan Shrimp:
1. In a bowl, stir together water, ketchup, soy sauce, cornstarch, honey, crushed red pepper, and ground ginger. Set aside.
  2. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in green onions and garlic; cook 30 seconds. Stir in shrimp, and toss to coat with oil. Stir in sauce. Cook and stir until sauce is bubbly and thickened.
Sweet, Salty, Spicy Party Nuts:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and lightly coat with cooking spray.
  2. Combine walnut halves, pecan halves, almonds, and cashews in a large bowl.
  3. Add salt, black pepper, cumin, and cayenne pepper; toss to coat.
  4. Heat sugar, water, and butter in a small saucepan over medium heat until the butter is melted. Cook for 1 minute and remove from heat. Slowly pour butter mixture over the bowl of nuts and stir to coat.
  5. Transfer nuts to the prepared baking sheet and spread into a single layer.
  6. Bake nuts in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Stir nuts until the warm syrup coats every nut.
  7. Spread into a single layer, return to the oven, and bake until nuts are sticky and roasted, about 6 minutes. Allow to cool before serving.
Waffles I:
1. Preheat waffle iron. Beat eggs in large bowl with hand beater until fluffy. Beat in flour, milk, vegetable oil, sugar, baking powder, salt and vanilla, just until smooth.
  2. Spray preheated waffle iron with non-stick cooking spray.
  3. Pour mix onto hot waffle iron. Cook until golden brown.
  4. Serve hot.
Beth's Spicy Oatmeal Raisin Cookies:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter, butter flavored shortening, brown sugar, white sugar, eggs, and vanilla until smooth.
  3. Combine the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, and salt; stir into the sugar mixture. Stir in the oats and raisins. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
  4. Bake 10 to 12 minutes until light and golden. Do not overbake.
  5. Let them cool for 2 minutes before removing from cookie sheets to cool completely. Store in airtight container. Make sure you get some, because they don't last long!

Home-Fried Potatoes.originalString: 1 green bell pepper, seeded and chopped
Home-Fried Potatoes.name: green bell pepper

Home-Fried Potatoes:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
  2. Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes.
  3. Drain, cool cut into 1/2 inch cubes.
  4. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil over medium high heat.
  5. Add onion and green pepper. Cook, stirring often, until soft; about 5 minutes.
  6. Transfer to a plate and set aside.
  7. Pour remaining 2 tablespoons of oil into the skillet and turn heat to medium-high.
  8. Add potato cubes, salt, paprika and black pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are browned; about 10 minutes. Stir in the onions, green peppers and parsley and cook for another minute.
  9. Serve hot.

Jalapeno Popper Spread.originalString: 1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chilies, drained
Jalapeno Popper Spread.name: green chilies

Jalapeno Popper Spread.originalString: 2 ounces canned diced jalapeno peppers, drained
Jalapeno Popper Spread.name: jalapeno peppers

Jalapeno Popper Spread:
1. Stir together cream cheese and mayonnaise in a large bowl until smooth. Stir in green chiles and jalapeno peppers.
  2. Pour mixture into a microwave safe serving dish, and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
  3. Microwave on High until hot, about 3 minutes.

Hot Ham 'n' Egg Sandwiches.originalString: 1 cup finely chopped fully cooked ham
Hot Ham 'n' Egg Sandwiches.name: cooked ham

Hot Ham 'n' Egg Sandwiches:
1. In a bowl, combine the ham, cheese, onion, olives and eggs. Stir in chili sauce and mayonnaise.
  2. Place about 1/3 cupful in each bun; wrap individually in foil.
  3. Place on a baking sheet.
  4. Bake at 400 degrees F for 10 minutes or until heated through.
Hot Crab Dip:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Beat cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth. Stir in the crabmeat, minced onion, lemon juice and Tabasco sauce. Spoon mixture into a small oven-proof dish that has been sprayed with cooking spray.
  3. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 minutes or until the sauce is bubbly.
  4. Serve with crackers, potato chips or tortilla chips. You can also use fresh crabmeat in place of the canned crabmeat.

Zucchini and Potato Bake.originalString: 2 medium zucchini, quartered and cut into large pieces
Zucchini and Potato Bake.name: zucchini

Zucchini and Potato Bake.originalString: 4 medium potatoes, peeled and cut into large chunks
Zucchini and Potato Bake.name: potatoes

Zucchini and Potato Bake.originalString: 1 medium red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
Zucchini and Potato Bake.name: red bell pepper

Zucchini and Potato Bake:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
  2. In a medium baking pan, toss together the zucchini, potatoes, red bell pepper, garlic, bread crumbs, and olive oil. Season with paprika, salt, and pepper.
  3. Bake 1 hour in the preheated oven, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender and lightly brown.

Garlic Shrimp Linguine.originalString: 1 pinch salt and pepper to taste
Garlic Shrimp Linguine.name: salt and pepper

Garlic Shrimp Linguine.originalString: 1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
Garlic Shrimp Linguine.name: shrimp

Garlic Shrimp Linguine:
1. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
  2. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
  3. In a medium saucepan, melt butter over medium low heat; add wine, cheese, garlic, parsley and salt and pepper to taste. Simmer over low heat for 3 to 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
  4. Increase heat to medium high and add shrimp to saucepan; cook for about 3 to 4 minutes or until shrimp begins to turn pink. Do not overcook.
  5. Divide pasta into portions and spoon sauce on top; garnish with Parmesan cheese and fresh parsley, if desired.

Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.originalString: 4 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.name: skinless boneless chicken thighs

Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.originalString: 2 pounds red potatoes, cut in 1-inch pieces
Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.name: red potatoes

Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.originalString: 1 pound beef stew meat, cut into bite-size pieces (optional)
Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.name: beef stew meat

Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.originalString: 1 (16 ounce) package frozen whole kernel corn
Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.name: corn kernel

Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.originalString: 1 (15 ounce) can cut green beans, drained
Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.name: green beans

Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.originalString: 1 0.42 oz packet concentrated vegetable base (such as Swanson® Vegetable Flavor Boost®)
Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah.name: vegetable

Slow Cooker Belgian Chicken Booyah:
1. Mix chicken, potatoes, beef, corn, carrots, green beans, chicken broth, beef broth, diced tomatoes, onion, celery, bell pepper, cabbage, salt, basil, oregano, celery salt, black pepper, and vegetable base in a slow cooker.
  2. Cook on Low for 6 hours.

Slow-Cooker Chicken Tortilla Soup.originalString: 1 (15 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, mashed
Slow-Cooker Chicken Tortilla Soup.name: canned tomatoes

Slow-Cooker Chicken Tortilla Soup.originalString: 1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers
Slow-Cooker Chicken Tortilla Soup.name: canned green chile peppers

Slow-Cooker Chicken Tortilla Soup:
1. Place chicken, tomatoes, enchilada sauce, onion, green chiles, and garlic into a slow cooker.
  2. Pour in water and chicken broth, and season with cumin, chili powder, salt, pepper, and bay leaf. Stir in corn and cilantro. Cover, and cook on Low setting for 6 to 8 hours or on High setting for 3 to 4 hours.
  3. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
  4. Lightly brush both sides of tortillas with oil.
  5. Cut tortillas into strips, then spread on a baking sheet.
  6. Bake in preheated oven until crisp, about 10 to 15 minutes. To serve, sprinkle tortilla strips over soup.
Brunch Enchiladas:
1. Place ham in food processor, and pulse until finely ground.
  2. Mix together ham, green onions, and green peppers. Spoon 1/3 cup of the ham mixture and 3 tablespoons shredded cheese onto each tortilla, then roll up. Carefully place filled tortillas, seam side down, in a greased 9x13 baking dish.
  3. In a medium bowl, mix together eggs, cream, and milk, flour, garlic powder, and hot pepper sauce.
  4. Pour egg mixture over tortillas. Cover, and refrigerate overnight.
  5. The next morning, preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  6. Bake, uncovered, in preheated oven for 50 to 60 minutes, or until set. Sprinkle casserole with remaining 1 cup shredded cheese.
  7. Bake about 3 minutes more, or until cheese melts.
  8. Let stand a least 10 minutes before serving.

Chef John's Coq Au Vin.originalString: 8 ounces bacon, sliced crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces
Chef John's Coq Au Vin.name: bacon

Chef John's Coq Au Vin.originalString: 1 pinch kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Chef John's Coq Au Vin.name: kosher salt

Chef John's Coq Au Vin:
