1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
  2. Season chicken thighs all over with salt and black pepper.
  3. Place bacon in a large, oven-proof skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
  4. Transfer bacon with a slotted spoon to a paper-towel lined plate, leaving drippings in the skillet.
  5. Increase heat to high and place chicken, skin-side down, into skillet. Cook in hot skillet until browned, 2 to 4 minutes per side.
  6. Transfer chicken to a plate; drain and discard all but 1 tablespoon drippings from the skillet.
  7. Lower heat to medium-high; saute mushrooms, onion, and shallots with a pinch of salt in the hot skillet until golden and caramelized, 7 to 12 minutes.
  8. Stir flour and butter into vegetable mixture until completely incorporated, about 1 minute.
  9. Pour red wine into the skillet and bring to a boil while scraping browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon. Stir bacon and thyme into red wine mixture; simmer until wine is about 1/3 reduced, 3 to 5 minutes.
  10. Pour chicken broth into wine mixture and set chicken thighs into skillet; bring wine and stock to a simmer.
  11. Cook chicken in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Spoon pan juices over the chicken and continue cooking until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 30 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
  12. Transfer chicken to a platter.
  13. Place skillet over high heat and reduce pan juices, skimming fat off the top as necessary, until sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper; remove and discard thyme.
  14. Pour sauce over chicken.
Gourmet Sweet Potato Classic:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
  2. Bake sweet potatoes 35 minutes in the preheated oven, or until they begin to soften. Cool slightly, peel, and mash.
  3. In a large bowl, mix the mashed sweet potatoes, salt, 1/4 cup butter, eggs, vanilla extract, cinnamon, sugar, and heavy cream.
  4. Transfer to the prepared baking dish.
  5. In a medium bowl, combine 1/4 cup butter, flour, brown sugar, and chopped pecans.
  6. Mix with a pastry blender or your fingers to the consistency of course meal. Sprinkle over the sweet potato mixture.
  7. Bake 30 minutes in the preheated oven, until topping is crisp and lightly browned.
Bacon Wrapped Smokies:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
  2. Refrigerate 2/3 of the bacon until needed. It is easier to wrap the wieners with cold bacon. Wrap each cocktail wiener with a piece of bacon and secure with a toothpick.
  3. Place on a large baking sheet. Sprinkle brown sugar generously over all.
  4. Bake for 40 minutes in the preheated oven, until the sugar is bubbly. To serve, place the wieners in a slow cooker and keep on the low setting.

Buffalo Chicken Dip.originalString: 3/4 cup pepper sauce (such as Frank's Red Hot®)
Buffalo Chicken Dip.name: pepper sauce

Buffalo Chicken Dip.originalString: 1 bunch celery, cleaned and cut into 4 inch pieces
Buffalo Chicken Dip.name: celery

Buffalo Chicken Dip:
1. Heat chicken and hot sauce in a skillet over medium heat, until heated through. Stir in cream cheese and ranch dressing. Cook, stirring until well blended and warm.
  2. Mix in half of the shredded cheese, and transfer the mixture to a slow cooker. Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top, cover, and cook on Low setting until hot and bubbly.
  3. Serve with celery sticks and crackers.
Country Sunday Breakfast Casserole:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease an 8x11-inch baking dish.
  2. Cook and stir breakfast sausage in a skillet over medium heat until browned and crumbly, about 10 minutes; drain excess grease.
  3. Mix green onion into sausage and spread mixture over bottom of the prepared baking dish.
  4. Spread hash brown potatoes in a layer over sausage; top with Cheddar cheese.
  5. Whisk eggs, milk, and gravy mix together in a bowl until smooth; pour over casserole. Season with paprika.
  6. Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted into the center of the casserole comes out clean, about 1 hour.
  7. Let stand 10 minutes to firm up before serving.
Cheese and Bacon Potato Rounds:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
  2. Brush both side of potato slices with butter; place them on an ungreased cookie sheet.
  3. Bake in the preheated 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) oven for 30 to 40 minutes or until lightly browned on both sides, turning once.
  4. When potatoes are ready, top with bacon, cheese, and green onion; continue baking until the cheese has melted
Chewy Chocolate Chip Oatmeal Cookies:
1. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter, brown sugar, and white sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
  3. Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt; stir into the creamed mixture until just blended.
  4. Mix in the quick oats, walnuts, and chocolate chips. Drop by heaping spoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets.
  5. Bake for 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Spinach Mushroom Omelet.originalString: 2 tablespoons finely chopped red bell pepper
Spinach Mushroom Omelet.name: red bell pepper

Spinach Mushroom Omelet:
1. Beat egg and egg whites in a small bowl.
  2. Mix in Parmesan cheese, Cheddar cheese, salt, red pepper flakes, garlic powder, nutmeg, and pepper.
  3. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir mushrooms, green onion, and bell pepper until tender, about 5 minutes.
  4. Place spinach in skillet and cook until just wilted. Stir in diced tomato and egg mixture; as eggs set, lift edges, letting uncooked portion flow underneath. Cook until egg mixture sets, 10 to 15 minutes; cut into wedges and serve immediately.
King Crab Appetizers:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease 12 tartlet pans.
  2. Divide rolls in half and press into the prepared tartlet pans. Set aside.
  3. In a large bowl, combine cream cheese, crab, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, Cheddar cheese, green onions and Worcestershire sauce. Spoon 1 teaspoon of mixture into tarts and garnish with paprika.
  4. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 15 to 20 minutes, or until light brown. These freeze wonderfully. Just reheat before serving.

Steve's Famous Garlic Home Fries.originalString: 4 (8 ounce) russet potatoes, quartered and sliced
Steve's Famous Garlic Home Fries.name: russet potatoes

Steve's Famous Garlic Home Fries:
1. Melt the butter or margarine in a large skillet over medium heat.
  2. Add the potatoes and spread out in an even layer. Cover and cook for about 5 minutes. Season with garlic, paprika, salt and pepper; stir to coat potatoes evenly.
  3. Cover and cook for another 15 minutes, turning potatoes occasionally.
  4. Remove cover, and mix in chives. Increase heat to medium-high and cook for another 10 minutes, stirring frequently, or until potatoes are tender.

Spinach Enchiladas.originalString: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach , thawed, drained and squeezed dry
Spinach Enchiladas.name: spinach

Spinach Enchiladas:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
  2. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
  3. Add garlic and onion; cook for a few minutes until fragrant, but not brown. Stir in spinach, and cook for about 5 more minutes.
  4. Remove from the heat, and mix in ricotta cheese, sour cream, and 1 cup of Monterey Jack cheese.
  5. In a skillet over medium heat, warm tortillas one at a time until flexible, about 15 seconds. Spoon about 1/4 cup of the spinach mixture onto the center of each tortilla.
  6. Roll up, and place seam side down in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
  7. Pour enchilada sauce over the top, and sprinkle with the remaining cup of Monterey Jack.
  8. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until sauce is bubbling and cheese is lightly browned at the edges.

Caesar Salad Supreme.originalString: 1 tablespoon lemon juice, or more to taste
Caesar Salad Supreme.name: lemon juice

Caesar Salad Supreme.originalString: 1 head romaine lettuce, torn into bite-size pieces
Caesar Salad Supreme.name: romaine lettuce

Caesar Salad Supreme:
1. Mince 3 cloves of garlic, and combine in a small bowl with mayonnaise, anchovies, 2 tablespoons of the Parmesan cheese, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, and lemon juice. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Refrigerate until ready to use.
  2. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
  3. Cut the remaining 3 cloves of garlic into quarters, and add to hot oil. Cook and stir until brown, and then remove garlic from pan.
  4. Add bread cubes to the hot oil. Cook, turning frequently, until lightly browned.
  5. Remove bread cubes from oil, and season with salt and pepper.
  6. Place lettuce in a large bowl. Toss with dressing, remaining Parmesan cheese, and seasoned bread cubes.

Amazing Muffin Cups.originalString: 3 cups frozen country style shredded hash brown potatoes, thawed
Amazing Muffin Cups.name: hash brown potatoes

Amazing Muffin Cups.originalString: chopped fresh chives or green onion
Amazing Muffin Cups.name: chives

Amazing Muffin Cups:
1. Prepare sausage according to package directions. cool slightly and cut into 1/2-inch pieces; set aside.
  2. In a bowl, combine hash browns, butter, salt and pepper; divide evenly into 12 greased muffin cups. Press mixture onto sides and bottom of muffin cups.
  3. Bake at 400 degrees F for 12 minutes or until lightly browned.
  4. Remove from oven; divide sausage pieces into muffin cups.
  5. In a bowl, combine eggs, cheese and bell pepper. Spoon mixture evenly into muffin cups. Sprinkle with chives or onion. Return to oven, bake 13-15 minutes or until set.
  6. Serve.

Roasted Vegetables.originalString: 2 red bell peppers, seeded and diced
Roasted Vegetables.name: red bell peppers

Roasted Vegetables.originalString: salt and freshly ground black pepper
Roasted Vegetables.name: salt and pepper

Roasted Vegetables:
1. Preheat oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C).
  2. In a large bowl, combine the squash, red bell peppers, sweet potato, and Yukon Gold potatoes. Separate the red onion quarters into pieces, and add them to the mixture.
  3. In a small bowl, stir together thyme, rosemary, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Toss with vegetables until they are coated.
  4. Spread evenly on a large roasting pan.
  5. Roast for 35 to 40 minutes in the preheated oven, stirring every 10 minutes, or until vegetables are cooked through and browned.
Basic Crepes:
1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour and the eggs. Gradually add in the milk and water, stirring to combine.
  2. Add the salt and butter; beat until smooth.
  3. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium high heat.
  4. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each crepe. Tilt the pan with a circular motion so that the batter coats the surface evenly.
  5. Cook the crepe for about 2 minutes, until the bottom is light brown. Loosen with a spatula, turn and cook the other side.
  6. Serve hot.
Pumpkin Bread IV:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour three 9x5 inch loaf pans.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the pumpkin, oil, sugar, and eggs.
  3. Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves; stir into the pumpkin mixture until well blended. Divide the batter evenly between the prepared pans.
  4. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes to 1 hour. The top of the loaf should spring back when lightly pressed.
Best Oven Baked French Toast:
1. Coat a 9x13-inch baking dish with melted butter.
  2. Spread any remaining melted butter over bottom of dish.
  3. Sprinkle brown sugar and cinnamon evenly over melted butter.
  4. Arrange bread in two layers over brown sugar mixture.
  5. Beat eggs, milk, and salt in a bowl; pour over bread.
  6. Cover and refrigerate overnight.
  7. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  8. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 30 minutes.

Chef John's Chicken and Dumplings.originalString: 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or as needed
Chef John's Chicken and Dumplings.name: flour

Chef John's Chicken and Dumplings.originalString: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Chef John's Chicken and Dumplings.name: salt and pepper

Chef John's Chicken and Dumplings.originalString: 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or more to taste
Chef John's Chicken and Dumplings.name: cayenne pepper

Chef John's Chicken and Dumplings:
1. Place chicken in a Dutch oven.
  2. Add water, carrot, celery, onion, 3 sprigs of thyme, and bay leaf. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer for 1 hour.
  3. Remove chicken from dutch oven and transfer to a bowl; set aside to cool.
  4. Increase heat and bring the stock to a simmer. Skim off any chicken fat that appears on top of the stock and reserve in a bowl.
  5. Combine 2 to 3 tablespoons of the reserved fat with flour in a small bowl; stir to make a paste, adding more flour if needed.
  6. Add the chicken fat and flour mixture to the stock. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
  7. Remove chicken meat from the carcass and add to the stock. Season with salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper to taste. Continue simmering for 10 to 15 minutes.
  8. Whisk creme fraiche, milk, 2 teaspoons of thyme leaves, and eggs together in a large bowl. Stir in self-rising flour until almost entirely incorporated; do not overmix.
  9. Scoop large dollops of dumpling mixture on top of the chicken stock. Increase heat slightly to medium-high. Cover and simmer until dumplings appear light and fluffy, and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 10 to 15 minutes.
  10. Serve garnish with thyme sprigs.
Honey Roasted Red Potatoes:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly coat an 11x7 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
  2. Place potatoes in a single layer in prepared dish, and top with onion. In a small bowl, combine melted butter, honey, mustard, salt and pepper; drizzle over potatoes and onion.
  3. Bake in the preheated 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) oven for 35 minutes or until tender, stirring halfway through the cooking time.
Yummy Veggie Omelet:
1. Melt one tablespoon butter in a medium skillet over medium heat.
  2. Place onion and bell pepper inside of the skillet. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes stirring occasionally until vegetables are just tender.
  3. While the vegetables are cooking beat the eggs with the milk, 1/2 teaspoon salt and pepper.
  4. Shred the cheese into a small bowl and set it aside.
  5. Remove the vegetables from heat, transfer them to another bowl and sprinkle the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt over them.
  6. Melt the remaining 1 tablespoon butter (in the skillet just used to cook the vegetables) over medium heat. Coat the skillet with the butter. When the butter is bubbly add the egg mixture and cook the egg for 2 minutes or until the eggs begin to set on the bottom of the pan. Gently lift the edges of the omelet with a spatula to let the uncooked part of the eggs flow toward the edges and cook. Continue cooking for 2 to 3 minutes or until the center of the omelet starts to look dry.
  7. Sprinkle the cheese over the omelet and spoon the vegetable mixture into the center of the omelet. Using a spatula gently fold one edge of the omelet over the vegetables.
  8. Let the omelet cook for another two minutes or until the cheese melts to your desired consistency. Slide the omelet out of the skillet and onto a plate.
  9. Cut in half and serve.

Ham And Cheese Frittata.originalString: 1/2 cup diced sweet red pepper or green pepper
Ham And Cheese Frittata.name: red pepper

Ham And Cheese Frittata:
1. In a large ovenproof skillet coated with nonstick cooking spray, saute the ham, red pepper and onion until ham is lightly browned and vegetables are tender.
  2. In a bowl, combine the eggs, cottage cheese and pepper; pour over ham mixture. As eggs set, lift edges, letting uncooked portion flow underneath. When the eggs are almost set, broil 4-6 in. from the heat for 1 minute or until top is set. Top with tomatoes and cheddar cheese. Broil 1 minute longer or until cheese is melted.

Scalloped Potatoes III.originalString: 2 (10.75 ounce) cans condensed cream of mushroom soup
Scalloped Potatoes III.name: condensed cream of mushroom soup

Scalloped Potatoes III.originalString: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of celery soup
Scalloped Potatoes III.name: condensed cream of celery soup

Scalloped Potatoes III.originalString: 1 (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix
Scalloped Potatoes III.name: dry onion soup mix

Scalloped Potatoes III:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
  2. In a medium bowl whisk together mushroom soup, celery soup, onion soup mix, garlic powder and milk.
  3. In a large roasting pan layer potatoes and soup mix, ending with soup mix. Season with salt and pepper; sprinkle cheese over the top.
  4. Bake in preheated oven for 60 to 80 minutes, or until potatoes are cooked.
  5. Let stand 5 to 10 minutes before serving.
Breakfast Casserole I:
1. Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown.
  2. Drain, crumble and set aside.
  3. Place a colander and two cups of water in a small stock pot.
  4. Add the broccoli and bring water to a boil. Cook until tender but still firm, about 10 minutes.
  5. Drain, cool and chop.
  6. Lightly butter a 9x13 inch baking pan. Lightly butter bread slices. Line bottom of baking pan with bread slices. Cover bread with cheese, bacon and broccoli.
  7. In a large bowl, beat together eggs, milk, mustard, salt and pepper.
  8. Pour egg mixture into pan. Refrigerate overnight or bake immediately.
  9. Twenty minutes before baking, preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
  10. Bake until eggs are solid, approximately 60 minutes.
Shrimp Lemon Pepper Linguini:
1. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
  2. Add linguine, and cook for 9 to 13 minutes or until al dente; drain.
  3. Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat, and saute garlic about 1 minute.
  4. Mix in chicken broth, wine, lemon juice, lemon zest, salt, and pepper. Reduce heat, and simmer until liquid is reduced by about 1/
  5. Mix shrimp, butter, parsley, and basil into the saucepan. Cook 2 to 3 minutes, until shrimp is opaque. Stir in the cooked linguine, and continue cooking 2 minutes, until well coated.

Cheesy Ham and Hash Brown Casserole.originalString: 1 (32 ounce) package frozen hash brown potatoes
Cheesy Ham and Hash Brown Casserole.name: hash brown potatoes

Cheesy Ham and Hash Brown Casserole.originalString: 2 (10.75 ounce) cans condensed cream of potato soup
Cheesy Ham and Hash Brown Casserole.name: cream of potato soup

Cheesy Ham and Hash Brown Casserole:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
  2. In a large bowl, mix hash browns, ham, cream of potato soup, sour cream, and Cheddar cheese.
  3. Spread evenly into prepared dish. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
  4. Bake 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until bubbly and lightly brown.
  5. Serve immediately.

Roasted Garlic Cauliflower.originalString: 1 large head cauliflower, separated into florets
Roasted Garlic Cauliflower.name: cauliflower

Roasted Garlic Cauliflower.originalString: salt and black pepper to taste
Roasted Garlic Cauliflower.name: salt and pepper

Roasted Garlic Cauliflower:
1. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a large casserole dish.
  2. Place the olive oil and garlic in a large resealable bag.
  3. Add cauliflower, and shake to mix.
  4. Pour into the prepared casserole dish, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. Bake for 25 minutes, stirring halfway through. Top with Parmesan cheese and parsley, and broil for 3 to 5 minutes, until golden brown.
Herbed Cream Cheese Omelet:
1. Mix the cream cheese with the cilantro in a bowl, adding salt and pepper to taste.
  2. Heat one-quarter of the butter in a well-seasoned omelet pan or 8 inch non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. When the butter is hot and bubbling, swirl it around in the pan.
  3. Just before the butter begins to brown, beat 2 of the eggs and pour into pan. Lower the heat.
  4. After 10 seconds or so, the omelet will coagulate. Push the omelet to one side of the pan with a spoon or spatula, and let the raw egg run over the cleared skillet. Repeat this one more time, then take the skillet off the heat.
  5. Dab one quarter of the herbed cream cheese along the middle of the omelet from one side to the other. Season the omelet with additional salt and pepper to taste. If it has not completely set, place the pan over medium heat for a half minute longer. When the omelet is set, slide it from the pan onto a plate so that the omelet rolls up and the herbed cream cheese runs along the length of the roll.
  6. Serve it right away. Make three more omelets the same way, making sure the pan and butter get good and hot before adding the beaten eggs.
  7. Serve each one as soon as it is cooked.
Aussie Omelet:
1. In a medium nonstick saucepan over medium heat, cook and stir the onion, garlic, mushrooms and pepper until tender, about 5 minutes
  2. Mix in shrimp, and cook until opaque.
  3. Remove from heat, and set aside.
  4. In a medium bowl, beat together eggs and milk.
  5. Mix in curry powder, salt and pepper.
  6. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
  7. Pour in egg mixture, and cook 5 minutes, or until firm. Top with Cheddar cheese, tomato and the onion and shrimp mixture. Fold eggs over filling, and serve warm.

Creamy Au Gratin Potatoes.originalString: 4 russet potatoes, sliced into 1/4 inch slices
Creamy Au Gratin Potatoes.name: russet potatoes

Creamy Au Gratin Potatoes:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Butter a 1 quart casserole dish.
  2. Layer 1/2 of the potatoes into bottom of the prepared casserole dish. Top with the onion slices, and add the remaining potatoes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  3. In a medium-size saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.
  4. Mix in the flour and salt, and stir constantly with a whisk for one minute. Stir in milk. Cook until mixture has thickened. Stir in cheese all at once, and continue stirring until melted, about 30 to 60 seconds.
  5. Pour cheese over the potatoes, and cover the dish with aluminum foil.
  6. Bake 1 1/2 hours in the preheated oven.

Fresh Corn and Zucchini Saute.originalString: freshly ground black pepper to taste
Fresh Corn and Zucchini Saute.name: black pepper

Fresh Corn and Zucchini Saute.originalString: 3 ears corn, husks and silk removed
Fresh Corn and Zucchini Saute.name: ears corn

Fresh Corn and Zucchini Saute:
1. Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned, 1 to 2 minutes. Cook and stir onion in the melted butter until translucent, about 5 minutes.
  2. Cut kernels from the ears of corn.
  3. Add zucchini and corn; cook and stir until zucchini is tender, about 8 minutes. Season with sea salt and pepper.

Oven Baked Omelet with Feta and Tomatoes.originalString: 1 cup fire roasted diced tomatoes, drained
Oven Baked Omelet with Feta and Tomatoes.name: fire roasted tomatoes

Oven Baked Omelet with Feta and Tomatoes.originalString: 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese with basil and sun-dried tomatoes
Oven Baked Omelet with Feta and Tomatoes.name: feta cheese

Oven Baked Omelet with Feta and Tomatoes.originalString: 8 ounces Italian bread, cut into bite-size cubes
Oven Baked Omelet with Feta and Tomatoes.name: italian bread

Oven Baked Omelet with Feta and Tomatoes:
1. Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a deep 9-inch baking dish.
  2. Combine eggs, milk, thyme, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
  3. Whisk until smooth. Stir in tomatoes and feta cheese; pour into prepared baking dish. Scatter bread pieces on top of egg mixture.
  4. Bake in preheated oven until eggs are fully set, 40-50 minutes.
Grilled Asparagus:
1. Preheat grill for high heat.
  2. Lightly coat the asparagus spears with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  3. Grill over high heat for 2 to 3 minutes, or to desired tenderness.
Tender Italian Baked Chicken:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
  2. In a bowl, mix the mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, and garlic powder.
  3. Place bread crumbs in a separate bowl. Dip chicken into the mayonnaise mixture, then into the bread crumbs to coat. Arrange coated chicken on a baking sheet.
  4. Bake 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until chicken juices run clear and coating is golden brown.

Ham Broccoli Braid.originalString: 2 (8 ounce) cans refrigerated crescent roll dough
Ham Broccoli Braid.name: crescent roll dough

Ham Broccoli Braid:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. In a large bowl, combine ham, broccoli, onion, parsley, mustard and cheese. Stir well.
  3. Unroll crescent roll dough, and arrange flat on a medium baking sheet. Pinch together perforations to form a single sheet of dough. Using a knife or scissors, cut 1 inch wide strips in towards the center, starting on the long sides. There should be a solid strip about 3 inches wide down the center, with the cut strips forming a fringe down each side.
  4. Spread the filling along the center strip. Fold the side strips over filling, alternating strips from each side. Pinch or twist to seal.
  5. Bake in preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes, until deep golden brown.
Yummy Sweet Potato Casserole:
1. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Put sweet potatoes in a medium saucepan with water to cover. Cook over medium high heat until tender; drain and mash.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the sweet potatoes, white sugar, eggs, salt, butter, milk and vanilla extract.
  3. Mix until smooth.
  4. Transfer to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
  5. In medium bowl, mix the brown sugar and flour.
  6. Cut in the butter until the mixture is coarse. Stir in the pecans. Sprinkle the mixture over the sweet potato mixture.
  7. Bake in the preheated oven 30 minutes, or until the topping is lightly brown.
Marinated Tuna Steak:
1. In a large non-reactive dish, mix together the orange juice, soy sauce, olive oil, lemon juice, parsley, garlic, oregano, and pepper.
  2. Place the tuna steaks in the marinade and turn to coat. Cover, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
  3. Preheat grill for high heat.
  4. Lightly oil grill grate. Cook the tuna steaks for 5 to 6 minutes, then turn and baste with the marinade. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, or to desired doneness. Discard any remaining marinade.

Ham and Cheese Breakfast Quiche.originalString: 2 (12 ounce) packages frozen hash brown potatoes
Ham and Cheese Breakfast Quiche.name: hash brown potatoes

Ham and Cheese Breakfast Quiche:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
  2. Squeeze any excess moisture from the potatoes and combine them with the melted butter or margarine in a small bowl. Press this mixture into the bottom and sides of an ungreased 10 inch pie pan.
  3. Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 25 minutes.
  4. Remove pan from oven and arrange the ham and cheese evenly over the potatoes. In a separate small bowl, beat together the eggs and the cream.
  5. Pour this over the ham and cheese.
  6. Return pan to oven and bake for 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 30 minutes, or until the custard has completely set.
Red Garlic Mashed Potatoes:
1. Place the potatoes into a large pot, and fill with enough water to cover.
  2. Add 1 teaspoon of the crushed garlic to the water for flavor. Bring to a boil, and cook for about 10 minutes, or until easily pierced with a fork.
  3. Drain the potatoes, and add the butter. Mash until the butter is melted.
  4. Mix in the half-and-half, steak seasoning, garlic powder, sugar, and remaining garlic.
  5. Mix potatoes with an electric mixer until smooth.

Apple Crisp II.originalString: 10 cups all-purpose apples, peeled, cored and sliced
Apple Crisp II.name: apples

Apple Crisp II:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degree C).
  2. Place the sliced apples in a 9x13 inch pan.
  3. Mix the white sugar, 1 tablespoon flour and ground cinnamon together, and sprinkle over apples.
  4. Pour water evenly over all.
  5. Combine the oats, 1 cup flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda and melted butter together. Crumble evenly over the apple mixture.
  6. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for about 45 minutes.

Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs.originalString: 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs.name: ground pepper

Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs.originalString: 1 tablespoon white sugar, or to taste (optional)
Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs.name: white sugar

Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs.originalString: 5 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into 1 inch cubes
Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs.name: skinless boneless chicken breast halves

Rosemary Ranch Chicken Kabobs:
1. In a medium bowl, stir together the olive oil, ranch dressing, Worcestershire sauce, rosemary, salt, lemon juice, white vinegar, pepper, and sugar.
  2. Let stand for 5 minutes.
  3. Place chicken in the bowl, and stir to coat with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
  4. Preheat the grill for medium-high heat. Thread chicken onto skewers and discard marinade.
  5. Lightly oil the grill grate. Grill skewers for 8 to 12 minutes, or until the chicken is no longer pink in the center, and the juices run clear.

Traditional Christmas Cheese Ball.originalString: 1 (2.5 ounce) package thinly sliced smoked beef, chopped
Traditional Christmas Cheese Ball.name: beef

Traditional Christmas Cheese Ball.originalString: 1 (2.25 ounce) can pimento-stuffed green olives, chopped
Traditional Christmas Cheese Ball.name: pimento stuffed olives

Traditional Christmas Cheese Ball.originalString: 1 small Vidalia or other sweet onion, minced
Traditional Christmas Cheese Ball.name: vidalia

Traditional Christmas Cheese Ball.originalString: 2 dashes Worcestershire sauce, or to taste
Traditional Christmas Cheese Ball.name: worcestershire sauce

Traditional Christmas Cheese Ball:
1. Mix the cream cheese, beef, olives, onion, and Worcestershire sauce together in a bowl until evenly blended. Keeping the mixture in the bowl, scrape it into a semi-ball shape. Cover, and refrigerate until firm, at least 2 hours.
  2. Place a large sheet of waxed paper on a flat surface. Sprinkle with walnuts.
  3. Roll the cheese ball in the walnuts until completely covered.
  4. Transfer the cheese ball to a serving plate, or rewrap with waxed paper and refrigerate until needed.

Turkey Cheeseburger Meatloaf.originalString: 7 slices turkey bacon, or more to taste
Turkey Cheeseburger Meatloaf.name: turkey bacon

Turkey Cheeseburger Meatloaf.originalString: 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce, or more to taste
Turkey Cheeseburger Meatloaf.name: worcestershire sauce

Turkey Cheeseburger Meatloaf:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat and cook turkey bacon until browned and crisp, about 5 minutes per side.
  3. Drain bacon on paper towels; crumble when cool.
  4. Mix cooked bacon with ground turkey, Cheddar cheese, egg, onion, crumbled French bread, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, and black pepper; turn the turkey meatloaf mixture into a 9x13-inch baking dish and form into a loaf shape in the middle of the dish.
  5. Mix ketchup, yellow mustard, and brown sugar together in a bowl, stirring to dissolve brown sugar.
  6. Spread the mixture over the turkey loaf.
  7. Bake the turkey loaf in the preheated oven until the juices run clear, loaf is no longer pink in the middle, and an instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the loaf reads at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees F), 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Orange Pecan French Toast:
1. In a small bowl, stir together the brown sugar, melted butter, and corn syrup.
  2. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish, and spread evenly. Sprinkle pecans over the sugar mixture. Arrange the bread slices in the bottom of the dish so they are in a snug single layer.
  3. In a medium bowl, whisk together the orange zest, orange juice, milk, sugar, cinnamon, vanilla, egg whites, and eggs.
  4. Pour this mixture over the bread, pressing on the bread slices to help absorb the liquid. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour, or overnight.
  5. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C ).
  6. Remove the cover from the baking dish, and let stand for 20 minutes at room temperature.
  7. Bake for 35 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown. Dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.
Fluffy Pancakes:
1. Combine milk with vinegar in a medium bowl and set aside for 5 minutes to "sour".
  2. Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large mixing bowl.
  3. Whisk egg and butter into "soured" milk.
  4. Pour the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and whisk until lumps are gone.
  5. Heat a large skillet over medium heat, and coat with cooking spray.
  6. Pour 1/4 cupfuls of batter onto the skillet, and cook until bubbles appear on the surface. Flip with a spatula, and cook until browned on the other side.

Easy Quiche.originalString: 1 (10 ounce) package chopped frozen broccoli, thawed and drained
Easy Quiche.name: broccoli

Easy Quiche:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 10 inch quiche dish.
  2. In a large bowl, beat together milk, eggs, baking mix, butter and parmesan cheese. Batter will be lumpy. Stir in broccoli, ham and Cheddar cheese.
  3. Pour into prepared quiche dish.
  4. Bake in preheated oven for 50 minutes, until eggs are set and top is golden brown.

Easy Breakfast Casserole from Country Cr.originalString: 3 cups assorted fresh vegetables (peppers, onions, and/or broccoli)
Easy Breakfast Casserole from Country Cr.name: stew vegetables

Easy Breakfast Casserole from Country Cr.originalString: 2 cups shredded low-fat Cheddar cheese, divided
Easy Breakfast Casserole from Country Cr.name: low fat shredded cheddar cheese

Easy Breakfast Casserole from Country Cr.originalString: 1 (16 ounce) package frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
Easy Breakfast Casserole from Country Cr.name: hash brown potatoes

Easy Breakfast Casserole from Country Cr:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 13 x 9-inch baking dish with 1 tablespoon Country Crock(R)
  2. Spread; set aside. Melt remaining
  3. Spread in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and cook vegetables, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 8 minutes.
  4. Whisk eggs with milk in large bowl. Stir in 1 1/2 cups cheese, cooked vegetables, potatoes and bacon.
  5. Pour into prepared baking dish.
  6. Cover with aluminum foil and bake 45 minutes. Uncover, then sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese and bake 30 minutes or until eggs are thoroughly cooked.

Spanish Potato Omelet.originalString: 2 tomatoes - peeled, seeded, and coarsely chopped
Spanish Potato Omelet.name: tomatoes

Spanish Potato Omelet:
1. In a large frying pan or skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Sprinkle potatoes lightly with salt and pepper. Cook until golden brown and crisp.
  2. Once the potatoes are golden, stir in the onions. Cook, stirring occasionally, until onions soften and begin to brown.
  3. Meanwhile, beat eggs together with salt and pepper.
  4. Pour eggs into pan and stir gently to combine. Reduce heat to low and cook until eggs begin to brown on the bottom.
  5. Loosen bottom of omelet with a spatula, invert a large plate over the pan, and carefully turn the omelet out onto it. Slide the omelet back into the pan with the uncooked side down. Cook until eggs are set.
  6. Garnish omelet with tomato and green onion and serve warm.

Chocolate Cappuccino Cheesecake.originalString: 2 teaspoons instant coffee granules dissolved in 1/4 cup hot water
Chocolate Cappuccino Cheesecake.name: instant coffee granules

Chocolate Cappuccino Cheesecake:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter one 9 or 10 inch springform pan.
  2. Combine the chocolate wafer crumbs, softened butter, 2 tablespoons white sugar, and the cinnamon.
  3. Mix well and press mixture into the buttered springform pan, set aside.
  4. In a medium sized bowl beat the softened cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add 1 cup white sugar mixing until well blended.
  5. Add eggs, one at a time. Beat at low speed until very smooth.
  6. Melt the 8 ounces semisweet chocolate with 2 tablespoons whipping cream in a pan or bowl set over boiling water, stir until smooth.
  7. Add chocolate mixture to cream cheese mixture and blend well. Stir in sour cream, salt, coffee, 1/4 cup coffee liqueur, and vanilla; beat until smooth.
  8. Pour mixture into prepared pan.
  9. Bake in the center of oven at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 45 minutes. Center will be soft but will firm up when chilled. Do not over bake. Leave cake in oven with the heat turned off and the door ajar for 45 minutes.
  10. Remove cake from oven and chill for 12 hours. Just before serving top cake with mounds of flavored whipped cream and garnish with chocolate leaves. Yields 16 servings.
  11. To Make Flavored Whipped Cream: Beat whipping cream until soft peaks form, then beat in confectioner's sugar and 2 tablespoons coffee liqueur.
  12. To Make Chocolate Leaves: Melt 1 ounce semisweet chocolate in a pan or bowl set over boiling water, stir until smooth.
  13. Brush real non-toxic plant leaves (such as orange leaves) on one side with melted chocolate. Freeze until firm and then peel off leaves. Freeze chocolate leaves until needed.

Bacon Potato Pancakes.originalString: salt and ground black pepper to taste
Bacon Potato Pancakes.name: ground pepper

Bacon Potato Pancakes.originalString: vegetable oil for frying, or as needed
Bacon Potato Pancakes.name: vegetable oil

Bacon Potato Pancakes:
1. Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp, 3 to 5 minutes.
  2. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain; let cool and crumble. Reserve bacon drippings in skillet.
  3. Combine crumbled bacon, potatoes, flour, eggs, garlic, thyme, salt, and black pepper in a large bowl.
  4. Pour vegetable oil about 1/4-inch deep into skillet with bacon drippings and place over medium heat; heat until the oil and bacon drippings shimmer.
  5. Gently drop potato mixture by heaping tablespoon into hot oil and flatten potatoes into small patties about 3 inches in diameter. Cook until browned, about 3 minutes on each side.
Garlic Red Potatoes:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Place potatoes in an 8x8 inch baking dish.
  3. In a small bowl combine melted butter, garlic, salt and lemon juice; pour over potatoes and stir to coat. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over potatoes.
  4. Bake, covered, in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake until golden brown and tender when pierced with a fork, about 10 minutes more.

Grilled Vegetables with Balsamic Vinegar.originalString: 2 green bell peppers, cut into 1/2-inch slices
Grilled Vegetables with Balsamic Vinegar.name: green bell peppers

Grilled Vegetables with Balsamic Vinegar:
1. Whisk olive oil, soy sauce, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Toss eggplants, zucchinis, and bell peppers in soy sauce marinade. Marinate for about 45 minutes.
  2. Preheat grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
  3. Remove vegetables from marinade, shaking off excess.
  4. Grill vegetables on preheated grill until tender, 10 to 15 minutes, brushing vegetables with marinade.
  5. Transfer cooked vegetables to a platter and serve with any remaining marinade.

Clark's Quiche.originalString: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed
Clark's Quiche.name: frozen spinach

Clark's Quiche:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
  2. Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown.
  3. Drain, crumble, and set aside. Cook spinach according to package instructions. Allow to cool, then squeeze dry.
  4. Heat olive oil in skillet over medium heat.
  5. Saute onions until soft and translucent. Stir in mushrooms, and cook for 2 minutes, or until soft. Stir in ham and cooked bacon.
  6. Remove from heat.
  7. In a large bowl, combine spinach, sour cream, salt and pepper. Divide, and spread into pie crusts. Layer with bacon mixture.
  8. Mix together Monterey Jack, Cheddar and Parmesan, and sprinkle over pies.
  9. Whisk together eggs, half-and-half and parsley. Season with salt and pepper, and pour over pies.
  10. Place pies on baking sheet, and bake on middle shelf in preheated oven for 40 minutes. The top will be puffed and golden brown.
  11. Remove from oven, and let stand for 5 to 10 minutes.

Baked Ham and Cheese Party Sandwiches.originalString: 1 pound thinly sliced cooked deli ham
Baked Ham and Cheese Party Sandwiches.name: deli ham

Baked Ham and Cheese Party Sandwiches:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
  2. In a bowl, mix together butter, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, poppy seeds, and dried onion. Separate the tops from bottoms of the rolls, and place the bottom pieces into the prepared baking dish. Layer about half the ham onto the rolls. Arrange the Swiss cheese over the ham, and top with remaining ham slices in a layer.
  3. Place the tops of the rolls onto the sandwiches.
  4. Pour the mustard mixture evenly over the rolls.
  5. Bake in the preheated oven until the rolls are lightly browned and the cheese has melted, about 20 minutes. Slice into individual rolls through the ham and cheese layers to serve.
Easy Sugar Cookies:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a small bowl, stir together flour, baking soda, and baking powder. Set aside.
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in egg and vanilla. Gradually blend in the dry ingredients.
  3. Roll rounded teaspoonfuls of dough into balls, and place onto ungreased cookie sheets.
  4. Bake 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden.
  5. Let stand on cookie sheet two minutes before removing to cool on wire racks.
Mom's Zucchini Bread:
1. Grease and flour two 8 x 4 inch pans. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
  2. Sift flour, salt, baking powder, soda, and cinnamon together in a bowl.
  3. Beat eggs, oil, vanilla, and sugar together in a large bowl.
  4. Add sifted ingredients to the creamed mixture, and beat well. Stir in zucchini and nuts until well combined.
  5. Pour batter into prepared pans.
  6. Bake for 40 to 60 minutes, or until tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan on rack for 20 minutes.
  7. Remove bread from pan, and completely cool.

Chicken Enchiladas II.originalString: 1 1/2 cups cubed cooked chicken breast meat
Chicken Enchiladas II.name: chicken breast meat

Chicken Enchiladas II.originalString: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
Chicken Enchiladas II.name: condensed cream of mushroom soup

Chicken Enchiladas II:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a large baking dish.
  2. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and saute the green onion until tender (about 3 to 4 minutes).
  3. Add the garlic powder, then stir in the green chiles, cream of mushroom soup and sour cream.
  4. Mix well. Reserve 3/4 of this sauce and set aside. To the remaining 1/4 of the sauce in the saucepan, add the chicken and 1/2 cup of shredded Cheddar cheese. Stir together.
  5. Fill each flour tortilla with the chicken mixture and roll up.
  6. Place seam side down in the prepared baking dish.
  7. In a small bowl combine the reserved 3/4 of the sauce with the milk. Spoon this mixture over the rolled tortillas and top with the remaining 1/2 cup of shredded Cheddar cheese.
  8. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly.

Zucchini Herb Casserole.originalString: 1/3 cup uncooked long grain white rice
Zucchini Herb Casserole.name: long grain rice

Zucchini Herb Casserole.originalString: 2 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, divided
Zucchini Herb Casserole.name: sharp cheddar cheese

Zucchini Herb Casserole:
1. Combine the rice and water in a saucepan, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 20 minutes, until rice is tender.
  2. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a shallow 1 1/2 quart casserole dish.
  3. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat, and cook the zucchini, green onions, and garlic 5 minutes, or until tender. Season with garlic salt, basil, paprika, and oregano.
  4. Mix in the cooked rice, tomatoes, and 1 cup cheese. Continue to cook and stir until heated through.
  5. Transfer to the prepared casserole dish. Top with remaining cheese.
  6. Bake uncovered 20 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

Chef John's Stuffed Peppers.originalString: 4 large green bell peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded
Chef John's Stuffed Peppers.name: green bell peppers

Chef John's Stuffed Peppers.originalString: 1 cup uncooked long grain white rice
Chef John's Stuffed Peppers.name: long grain rice

Chef John's Stuffed Peppers.originalString: 1 cup finely grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, plus more for topping
Chef John's Stuffed Peppers.name: parmigiano reggiano cheese

Chef John's Stuffed Peppers.originalString: 1/4 pound hot Italian pork sausage, casing removed
Chef John's Stuffed Peppers.name: pork sausage

Chef John's Stuffed Peppers:
1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
  2. Bring rice and water to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender, and the liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes. Set the cooked rice aside.
  3. Cook onion and olive oil over medium heat until onion begins to soften, about 5 minutes.
  4. Transfer half of cooked onion to a large bowl and set aside.
  5. Stir marinara sauce, beef broth, balsamic vinegar, and red pepper flakes into the skillet; cook and stir for 1 minute.
  6. Pour sauce mixture into a 9x13-inch baking dish and set aside.
  7. Combine ground beef, Italian sausage, diced tomatoes, Italian parsley, garlic, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper into bowl with reserved onions; mix well. Stir in cooked rice and Parmigiano Reggiano. Stuff green bell peppers with beef and sausage mixture.
  8. Place stuffed green bell pepper halves in the baking dish over tomato sauce; sprinkle with remaining Parmigiano-Reggiano, cover baking dish with aluminum foil, and bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes.
  9. Remove aluminum foil and bake until the meat is no longer pink, the green peppers are tender and the cheese is browned on top, an addition 20 to 25 minutes.

Hammy Egg Maple Bagel.originalString: salt and ground black pepper to taste
Hammy Egg Maple Bagel.name: ground pepper

Hammy Egg Maple Bagel:
1. Heat 1 1/2 teaspoons butter in a skillet over medium heat; arrange bagel halves, cut sides down, in the melted butter. Cook until bagel is very slightly toasted and softened, 1 to 2 minutes per side.
  2. Transfer bagel to a plate.
  3. Cook ham slices in the same skillet until heated through, 1 to 2 minutes. Arrange 2 ham slices onto each bagel half.
  4. Heat remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons butter in the same skillet; cook eggs in the melted butter until whites are set but yolks are still runny, about 3 minutes. Gently flip eggs and cook until whites are set, about 1 more minute. Season eggs with salt and pepper. Layer eggs and American cheese slices onto 1 bagel half; top with the second bagel half, creating a sandwich.
  5. Place bagel sandwich back in the skillet and cover with a lid; heat until cheese is melted, about 45 seconds per side.
  6. Transfer bagel sandwich to a plate; drizzle with maple syrup.
Cheesy Potato Pancakes:
1. Mix together potatoes, eggs, and milk in a large bowl.
  2. Stir flour, Parmesan cheese, Cheddar cheese, bacon bits, onion salt, baking powder, salt, and black pepper into potato mixture using a fork.
  3. Heat corn oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
  4. Spoon about 2 tablespoons potato mixture into per patty into skillet. Cook patties until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side.
  5. Drain cooked pancakes on paper towel-lined plate.

Hash Brown and Egg Casserole.originalString: 1 (2 pound) package frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
Hash Brown and Egg Casserole.name: hash brown potatoes

Hash Brown and Egg Casserole.originalString: salt and ground black pepper to taste
Hash Brown and Egg Casserole.name: ground pepper

Hash Brown and Egg Casserole:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2 quart baking dish.
  2. Place the hash brown potatoes in the bottom of the baking dish.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium heat and cook and stir the sausage and onion until the sausage is crumbly, evenly browned, and no longer pink; drain. Meanwhile, whisk together the eggs, milk, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper, and pour over the potatoes. Layer with half the Cheddar cheese, the sausage mixture, and the remaining Cheddar cheese. Cover with aluminum foil.
  4. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour.
  5. Remove cover; return casserole to the oven and bake until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean, about 10 minutes.
  6. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.
Sauteed Garlic Asparagus:
1. Melt the butter or margarine in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
  2. Add the garlic and asparagus spears; cover and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until asparagus is tender. If you like your asparagus well done, reduce heat and cook an additional 10 minutes.
Chicken Cordon Bleu II:
1. Pound chicken breasts if they are too thick.
  2. Place a cheese and ham slice on each breast within 1/2 inch of the edges. Fold the edges of the chicken over the filling, and secure with toothpicks.
  3. Mix the flour and paprika in a small bowl, and coat the chicken pieces.
  4. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat, and cook the chicken until browned on all sides.
  5. Add the wine and bouillon. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear.
  6. Remove the toothpicks, and transfer the breasts to a warm platter. Blend the cornstarch with the cream in a small bowl, and whisk slowly into the skillet. Cook, stirring until thickened, and pour over the chicken.
  7. Serve warm.

Simple Hamburger Stroganoff.originalString: 1 (.75 ounce) packet dry brown gravy mix
Simple Hamburger Stroganoff.name: brown gravy

Simple Hamburger Stroganoff.originalString: 1 (6 ounce) can chopped mushrooms, with liquid
Simple Hamburger Stroganoff.name: canned mushrooms

Simple Hamburger Stroganoff.originalString: 2 (10.75 ounce) cans condensed cream of mushroom soup
Simple Hamburger Stroganoff.name: condensed cream of mushroom soup

Simple Hamburger Stroganoff:
1. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
  2. Add egg noodles and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
  3. In a skillet over medium heat, brown the ground beef until no pink shows, about 5 minutes; drain fat.
  4. Mix brown gravy, cream cheese, and mushrooms with hamburger, stirring until cream cheese melts.
  5. Add milk, sour cream, and mushroom soup to cooked pasta. Blend hamburger mixture with pasta.
Cheesy Horseradish Omelet:
1. In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs and herb seasoning blend.
  2. Place a lightly greased skillet over medium-high heat. When hot, pour the egg mixture in, and turn the skillet to coat evenly. Cook until almost done, then flip over.
  3. Spread the top with horseradish and sprinkle with Cheddar and Parmesan cheeses. Continue to cook until the bottom is no longer raw. Fold in half and transfer to a plate for serving.
Iced Pumpkin Cookies:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, ground cloves, and salt; set aside.
  3. In a medium bowl, cream together the 1/2 cup of butter and white sugar.
  4. Add pumpkin, egg, and 1 teaspoon vanilla to butter mixture, and beat until creamy.
  5. Mix in dry ingredients. Drop on cookie sheet by tablespoonfuls; flatten slightly.
  6. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool cookies, then drizzle glaze with fork.
  7. To Make Glaze:
  8. Combine confectioners' sugar, milk, 1 tablespoon melted butter, and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
  9. Add milk as needed, to achieve drizzling consistency.
Slow Cooker Mashed Potatoes:
1. In a large pot of lightly salted boiling water, cook the potatoes, garlic, and bouillon until potatoes are tender but firm, about 15 minutes.
  2. Drain, reserving water. In a bowl, mash potatoes with sour cream and cream cheese, adding reserved water as needed to attain desired consistency.
  3. Transfer the potato mixture to a slow cooker, cover, and cook on Low for 2 to 3 hours. Just before serving, stir in butter and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Sausage Casserole.originalString: 3 cups shredded potatoes, drained and pressed
Sausage Casserole.name: potatoes

Sausage Casserole.originalString: 1 (16 ounce) container small curd cottage cheese
Sausage Casserole.name: small-curd cottage cheese

Sausage Casserole:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch square baking dish.
  2. Place sausage in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown.
  3. Drain, crumble, and set aside.
  4. In the prepared baking dish, stir together the shredded potatoes and butter. Line the bottom and sides of the baking dish with the mixture. In a bowl, mix the sausage, Cheddar cheese, onion, cottage cheese, and eggs.
  5. Pour over the potato mixture.
  6. Bake 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into center of the casserole comes out clean.
  7. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
Cinnamon Bread I:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease one 9x5 inch loaf pan.
  2. Measure flour, 1 cup sugar, baking powder, baking soda, 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon, salt, buttermilk, oil, eggs and vanilla into large mixing bowl. Beat 3 minutes.
  3. Pour into prepared loaf pan. Smooth top.
  4. Combine 2 tablespoons white sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon and butter, mixing until crumbly. Sprinkle topping over smoothed batter. Using knife, cut in a light swirling motion to give a marbled effect.
  5. Bake for about 50 minutes. Test with toothpick. When inserted it should come out clean.
  6. Remove bread from pan to rack to cool.

Momma's Mashed Potatoes.originalString: 2 1/2 pounds russet potatoes, peeled and cubed
Momma's Mashed Potatoes.name: russet potatoes

Momma's Mashed Potatoes.originalString: salt and black pepper to taste
Momma's Mashed Potatoes.name: salt and pepper

Momma's Mashed Potatoes:
1. Place potatoes and lemon juice in a large saucepan, and add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, and cook until tender, about 15 minutes.
  2. Drain water from potatoes, and use a potato masher to mash. Stir in egg white and butter, and gradually mix in the half-and-half using the masher. Use more or less cream to reach your desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Christmas Brunch Casserole.originalString: 4 cups frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
Christmas Brunch Casserole.name: hash brown potatoes

Christmas Brunch Casserole:
1. Place bacon in a large skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown.
  2. Drain and set aside.
  3. Add the mushrooms and onion to the skillet; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent and the mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes.
  4. Grease a 9x13-inch casserole dish with the tablespoon of butter.
  5. Place potatoes in bottom of prepared dish. Sprinkle with salt, garlic salt, and pepper. Top with crumbled bacon, then add the onions and mushrooms.
  6. In a mixing bowl, beat the eggs with the milk and parsley.
  7. Pour the beaten eggs over the casserole and top with grated cheese. Cover and refrigerate overnight.
  8. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
  9. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour or until set.
Classic Waffles:
1. In a large bowl, mix together flour, salt, baking powder and sugar; set aside. Preheat waffle iron to desired temperature.
  2. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs. Stir in the milk, butter and vanilla.
  3. Pour the milk mixture into the flour mixture; beat until blended.
  4. Ladle the batter into a preheated waffle iron. Cook the waffles until golden and crisp.
  5. Serve immediately.

Apple Pie by Grandma Ople.originalString: 8 Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored and sliced
Apple Pie by Grandma Ople.name: granny smith apples

Apple Pie by Grandma Ople.originalString: 1 recipe pastry for a 9 inch double crust pie
Apple Pie by Grandma Ople.name: egg pastry
metaInformation: for a 9 inch double crust pie

Apple Pie by Grandma Ople:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Melt the butter in a saucepan. Stir in flour to form a paste.
  2. Add water, white sugar and brown sugar, and bring to a boil. Reduce temperature and let simmer.
  3. Place the bottom crust in your pan. Fill with apples, mounded slightly. Cover with a lattice work crust. Gently pour the sugar and butter liquid over the crust.
  4. Pour slowly so that it does not run off.
  5. Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Reduce the temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Continue baking for 35 to 45 minutes, until apples are soft.
Black Magic Cake:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9 inch round cake pans or one 9x13 inch pan.
  2. In large bowl combine flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder and salt. Make a well in the center.
  3. Add eggs, coffee, buttermilk, oil and vanilla. Beat for 2 minutes on medium speed. Batter will be thin.
  4. Pour into prepared pans.
  5. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 to 40 minutes, or until toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes, then remove from pans and finish cooling on a wire rack. Fill and frost as desired.

Slow Cooker Chicken and Dumplings.originalString: 2 (10 ounce) packages refrigerated biscuit dough, torn into pieces
Slow Cooker Chicken and Dumplings.name: biscuit dough

Slow Cooker Chicken and Dumplings.originalString: 2 (10.75 ounce) cans condensed cream of chicken soup
Slow Cooker Chicken and Dumplings.name: condensed cream of chicken soup

Slow Cooker Chicken and Dumplings:
1. Place the chicken, butter, soup, and onion in a slow cooker, and fill with enough water to cover.
  2. Cover, and cook for 5 to 6 hours on High. About 30 minutes before serving, place the torn biscuit dough in the slow cooker. Cook until the dough is no longer raw in the center.
Garlic Chicken:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
  2. Heat olive oil and garlic in a small saucepan over low heat until warmed, 1 to 2 minutes.
  3. Transfer garlic and oil to a shallow bowl.
  4. Combine bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese in a separate shallow bowl.
  5. Dip chicken breasts in the olive oil-garlic mixture using tongs; transfer to bread crumb mixture and turn to evenly coat.
  6. Transfer coated chicken to a shallow baking dish.
  7. Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink and juices run clear, 30 to 35 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Roast Chicken with Thyme and Onions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a medium baking dish.
  2. Pierce lemons several times with a fork, and place 1 inside each chicken cavity. Arrange chickens in the center of the prepared baking dish.
  3. Place onions, shallots, and garlic around the chickens. Sprinkle vegetables with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
  4. Spread butter over the chickens, and line each with thyme sprigs.
  5. Bake 20 minutes in the preheated oven. Increase temperature to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C), and continue baking 30 minutes, or until exterior of chicken is golden brown, meat is no longer pink, and juices run clear. Allow to cool about 15 minutes before serving.

Deluxe Corned Beef Hash.originalString: 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
Deluxe Corned Beef Hash.name: ground pepper

Deluxe Corned Beef Hash.originalString: 5 large Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/4-inch cubes
Deluxe Corned Beef Hash.name: yukon gold potatoes

Deluxe Corned Beef Hash:
1. Melt butter with the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat, and cook the onion just until it begins to brown, about 8 minutes; stir in the potatoes and carrot, and cook until tender, about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in the cubed corned beef, parsley, thyme, salt, and pepper.
  2. Let the mixture cook until hash is crisp and browned, stirring often, 10 to 15 more minutes.
Rich and Creamy Potatoes Au Gratin:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Place potatoes, garlic, and salt into a large pot, fill with enough water to cover, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium, and simmer the potatoes until tender but not mushy, 8 to 10 minutes. With a slotted spoon, transfer about half the potatoes to a 9x13-inch baking dish.
  3. Pour half of the cream over the potatoes, season with black pepper and nutmeg, and sprinkle half of the Gruyere cheese onto the mixture. Top with the remaining potatoes; sprinkle again with black pepper and nutmeg.
  4. Pour on the remaining cream, and sprinkle with remaining Gruyere cheese.
  5. Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese topping is crisp and brown on top, about 1 hour.
Restaurant-Style Buffalo Chicken Wings:
1. In a small bowl mix together the flour, paprika, cayenne pepper and salt.
  2. Place chicken wings in a large nonporous glass dish or bowl and sprinkle flour mixture over them until they are evenly coated. Cover dish or bowl and refrigerate for 60 to 90 minutes.
  3. Heat oil in a deep fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). The oil should be just enough to cover wings entirely, an inch or so deep.
  4. Combine the butter, hot sauce, pepper and garlic powder in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir together and heat until butter is melted and mixture is well blended.
  5. Remove from heat and reserve for serving.
  6. Fry coated wings in hot oil for 10 to 15 minutes, or until parts of wings begin to turn brown.
  7. Remove from heat, place wings in serving bowl, add hot sauce mixture and stir together.
  8. Serve.
Oven Scrambled Eggs:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Pour melted butter into a glass 9x13 inch baking dish. In a large bowl, whisk together eggs and salt until well blended. Gradually whisk in milk.
  3. Pour egg mixture into the baking dish.
  4. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes, then stir, and bake an additional 10 to 15 minutes, or until eggs are set.
  5. Serve immediately.
The Best Rolled Sugar Cookies:
1. In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Stir in the flour, baking powder, and salt. Cover, and chill dough for at least one hour (or overnight).
  2. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
  3. Roll out dough on floured surface 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick.
  4. Cut into shapes with any cookie cutter.
  5. Place cookies 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets.
  6. Bake 6 to 8 minutes in preheated oven. Cool completely.
Chantal's New York Cheesecake:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch springform pan.
  2. In a medium bowl, mix graham cracker crumbs with melted butter. Press onto bottom of springform pan.
  3. In a large bowl, mix cream cheese with sugar until smooth. Blend in milk, and then mix in the eggs one at a time, mixing just enough to incorporate.
  4. Mix in sour cream, vanilla and flour until smooth.
  5. Pour filling into prepared crust.
  6. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour. Turn the oven off, and let cake cool in oven with the door closed for 5 to 6 hours; this prevents cracking. Chill in refrigerator until serving.
Hot Artichoke and Spinach Dip II:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a small baking dish.
  2. In a medium bowl, mix together cream cheese, mayonnaise, Parmesan cheese, Romano cheese, garlic, basil, garlic salt, salt and pepper. Gently stir in artichoke hearts and spinach.
  3. Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking dish. Top with mozzarella cheese.
  4. Bake in the preheated oven 25 minutes, until bubbly and lightly browned.
French Toast Casserole:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly butter an 8x8 inch baking pan.
  2. Line bottom of pan with bread cubes. In a large bowl, beat together eggs, milk, 2 tablespoons sugar, salt and vanilla. pour egg mixture over bread. Dot with margarine; let stand for 10 minutes.
  3. Combine remaining 2 tablespoons sugar with 1 teaspoon cinnamon and sprinkle over the top.
  4. Bake in preheated oven about 45 to 50 minutes, until top is golden.

How to Make Country Gravy.originalString: 8 ounces breakfast sausage links, casings removed and meat broken up
How to Make Country Gravy.name: sausage links

How to Make Country Gravy.originalString: 1/2 cup chopped green onions (light parts only)
How to Make Country Gravy.name: green onions

How to Make Country Gravy.originalString: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
How to Make Country Gravy.name: cayenne pepper

How to Make Country Gravy.originalString: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
How to Make Country Gravy.name: salt and pepper

How to Make Country Gravy:
1. Melt butter in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat; cook sausage and bacon in the hot butter, stirring to break the sausage up into small pieces, until sausage is browned and bacon is almost crisp, about 10 minutes.
  2. Mix 1/2 cup green onion into sausage mixture and saute until onions are soft, about 3 more minutes.
  3. Stir flour into meat mixture, 1 to 2 tablespoons at a time, until thoroughly combined and mixture is pasty. Cook, stirring often, 2 to 3 minutes to remove raw taste of flour.
  4. Whisk milk into meat mixture, about 1 cup at a time, until combined. Continue to whisk until gravy begins to thicken, about 5 minutes. Turn heat to medium-high, bring gravy to a simmer, and season with a pinch of cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Reduce heat to medium-low.
  5. Continue to simmer gravy until flavors have blended and gravy is thick, 10 to 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon green onion and a pinch of cayenne pepper for garnish.

The Best Parmesan Chicken Bake.originalString: 2 cloves garlic, crushed and finely chopped
The Best Parmesan Chicken Bake.name: garlic

The Best Parmesan Chicken Bake.originalString: 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, or to taste
The Best Parmesan Chicken Bake.name: red pepper flakes

The Best Parmesan Chicken Bake.originalString: 1 (8 ounce) package shredded mozzarella cheese, divided
The Best Parmesan Chicken Bake.name: shredded mozzarella cheese

The Best Parmesan Chicken Bake:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Coat the bottom of a 9x13 inch casserole dish with olive oil, and sprinkle with garlic and hot red pepper flakes.
  3. Arrange the chicken breasts in bottom of the dish, and pour marinara sauce over chicken. Sprinkle basil over marinara sauce, and top with half the mozzarella cheese, followed by half the Parmesan cheese. Sprinkle on the croutons, then top with the remaining mozzarella cheese and remaining Parmesan cheese.
  4. Bake in preheated oven until cheese and croutons are golden brown and the chicken is no longer pink inside, about 35 minutes to an hour, depending on the shape and thickness of your chicken breasts. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of a chicken breast should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).
Potato Skillet:
1. Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium-high heat until evenly brown.
  2. Remove bacon slices, reserving grease. Crumble bacon and set aside.
  3. Add potatoes to bacon grease and season with garlic salt, seasoned salt and black pepper. Cook until potatoes are soft.
  4. When potatoes are tender, add crumbled bacon.
  5. Pour eggs over potatoes and cook until firm.
  6. Spread with cheese and cover with lid until melted.
Broccoli Quiche with Mashed Potato Crust:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
  3. Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes; drain. Meanwhile, place broccoli in a steamer over 1 inch of boiling water, and cover. Cook until tender but still firm, about 2 to 6 minutes.
  4. Drain and set aside.
  5. Mash the potatoes with milk and salt.
  6. Brush a deep 9 inch pie dish with olive oil and press the potatoes in.
  7. Brush with remaining olive oil.
  8. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes or until lightly browned.
  9. Arrange onions, broccoli and cheese in the potato crust.
  10. Whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, pepper and nutmeg.
  11. Pour over broccoli and cheese.
  12. Bake in preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes, until slightly puffed and cooked throughout. Allow to cool for 10 minutes before serving.
Chef John's Salmon Cakes:
1. Stir salmon, eggs, lemon juice, capers, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl until well-combined.
  2. Crush saltine crackers with your hands into the salmon mixture and mix well. Wrap the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate, 30 minutes to overnight.
  3. Dust a plate with half the bread crumbs. Divide salmon mixture into 4 portions and shape into patties; place onto prepared plate and sprinkle remaining bread crumbs atop the salmon patties.
  4. Melt butter and oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook patties in hot oil until cooked and heated through, about 5 minutes per side.
Chef John's Baked Lemon Pepper Salmon:
1. Whisk together lemon juice and black pepper in small bowl.
  2. Add mayonnaise, miso paste, Dijon mustard, and cayenne pepper to lemon-pepper mixture; whisk together.
  3. Spread the lemon-pepper mixture over salmon fillets. Reserve about a tablespoon for later use.
  4. Cover salmon with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
  5. Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or silicone baking mat.
  6. Place fillets on the prepared baking sheet.
  7. Spread remaining lemon-pepper mixture on fillets without letting it pool around base. Sprinkle with a pinch more black pepper and a generous amount of sea salt.
  8. Bake in the preheated oven until the fish flakes easily with a fork, 10 to 15 minutes.

Apple Cider Sauce and Pork Loin Chops.originalString: 1 (8 ounce) container frozen apple cider concentrate, undiluted
Apple Cider Sauce and Pork Loin Chops.name: apple cider

Apple Cider Sauce and Pork Loin Chops:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
  2. Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe frying pan over medium-high heat. Sprinkle chops with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and poultry seasoning.
  3. Place in hot oil, and brown on both sides.
  4. Drizzle Worcestershire sauce over chops, and pour in apple cider.
  5. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes.
  6. Remove chops to a plate, and return frying pan to stove over medium-high heat. Stir sherry into pan, and boil until sauce thickens, stirring frequently.
  7. Serve sauce over chops.
Grilled Fish Steaks:
1. In a stainless steel or glass bowl, combine garlic, olive oil, basil, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and parsley.
  2. Place the halibut filets in a shallow glass dish or a resealable plastic bag, and pour the marinade over the fish. Cover or seal and place in the refrigerator for 1 hour, turning occasionally.
  3. Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil grate. Set grate 4 inches from the heat.
  4. Remove halibut filets from marinade and drain off the excess. Grill filets 5 minutes per side or until fish is done when easily flaked with a fork.
Brooke's Best Bombshell Brownies:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13 baking dish.
  2. Combine the melted butter, sugar, and vanilla in a large bowl. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each, until thoroughly blended.
  3. Sift the flour, cocoa powder, and salt in a bowl. Gradually stir flour mixture into the egg mixture until blended. Stir in the chocolate morsels.
  4. Spread the batter evenly into the prepared baking dish.
  5. Bake in preheated oven until an inserted toothpick comes out clean, 35 to 40 minutes.
  6. Remove, and cool pan on wire rack before cutting.

Rosemary Roasted Butternut Squash.originalString: 2 tablespoons olive oil, or more to taste
Rosemary Roasted Butternut Squash.name: olive oil

Rosemary Roasted Butternut Squash:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
  2. Mix butternut squash cubes, garlic, rosemary, olive oil, salt, and black pepper until well coated.
  3. Spread mixture into a large baking dish.
  4. Bake in preheated oven until squash is caramelized and golden brown, 45 to 50 minutes.
Baked Teriyaki Chicken:
1. In a small saucepan over low heat, combine the cornstarch, cold water, sugar, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, ginger and ground black pepper.
  2. Let simmer, stirring frequently, until sauce thickens and bubbles.
  3. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
  4. Place chicken pieces in a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
  5. Brush chicken with the sauce. Turn pieces over, and brush again.
  6. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Turn pieces over, and bake for another 30 minutes, until no longer pink and juices run clear.
  7. Brush with sauce every 10 minutes during cooking.
Fluffy French Toast:
1. Measure flour into a large mixing bowl. Slowly whisk in the milk.
  2. Whisk in the salt, eggs, cinnamon, vanilla extract and sugar until smooth.
  3. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium heat.
  4. Soak bread slices in mixture until saturated. Cook bread on each side until golden brown.
  5. Serve hot.

Ham Breakfast Braid.originalString: 2 (8 ounce) packages refrigerated crescent roll dough
Ham Breakfast Braid.name: crescent roll dough

Ham Breakfast Braid:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
  2. Beat milk and cream cheese together until smooth.
  3. Mix in eggs, and season with salt and pepper.
  4. Heat a lightly oiled skillet over medium high heat and cook egg mixture until eggs are almost set.
  5. Arrange the crescent rolls from one package into a rectangle shape on top of a lightly greased cookie sheet.
  6. Place rolls from remaining package along the edges of the two long sides of the rectangle, with the broad half of the rolls on top of the first layer of rolls, and the pointed ends extending over the sides of the pan.
  7. Arrange the ham in a layer down the center of the dough. Spoon the cooked egg mixture on top of the ham and then sprinkle the cheddar cheese on top of the eggs. Bring the corners of the rolls together over the cheese to form a 'braid' shape.
  8. Bake in preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, until cheese is melted and rolls are golden brown.

Antipasto.originalString: 1 tablespoon pickling spice, wrapped in cheesecloth
Antipasto.name: bbq spice

Antipasto.originalString: 1 1/2 (6 ounce) cans tuna, drained and flaked
Antipasto.name: canned tuna

Antipasto:
1. In a large bowl with enough lightly salted water to cover, place the cauliflower, pearl onions, red bell peppers, green bell peppers, celery and cucumbers. Soak 8 to 12 hours, or overnight.
  2. In a small bowl with enough lightly salted water to cover, place the carrots. Soak 8 to 12 hours, or overnight.
  3. In a large saucepan, place the vegetable oil, vinegar, tomato paste and pickling spice. Bring the mixture to a boil.
  4. Drain and rinse the carrots, and place them in the mixture. Boil 10 minutes.
  5. Drain and rinse the vegetables in the cauliflower mixture.
  6. Place them into the saucepan. Cook 10 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender but crisp.
  7. Stir black olives, green olives, mushrooms and tuna into the mixture.
  8. Remove the mixture from heat. Discard the wrapped pickling spice. While still hot, transfer to sterile containers and refrigerate.
Big Soft Ginger Cookies:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift together the flour, ginger, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, and salt. Set aside.
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the margarine and 1 cup sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg, then stir in the water and molasses. Gradually stir the sifted ingredients into the molasses mixture. Shape dough into walnut sized balls, and roll them in the remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar.
  3. Place the cookies 2 inches apart onto an ungreased cookie sheet, and flatten slightly.
  4. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

Refried Beans Without the Refry.originalString: 1/2 fresh jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped
Refried Beans Without the Refry.name: fresh jalapeno pepper

Refried Beans Without the Refry:
1. Place the onion, rinsed beans, jalapeno, garlic, salt, pepper, and cumin into a slow cooker.
  2. Pour in the water and stir to combine. Cook on High for 8 hours, adding more water as needed. Note: if more than 1 cup of water has evaporated during cooking, then the temperature is too high.
  3. Once the beans have cooked, strain them, and reserve the liquid. Mash the beans with a potato masher, adding the reserved water as needed to attain desired consistency.

Boneless Pork Chop with Shallot Mustard.originalString: salt and ground black pepper to taste
Boneless Pork Chop with Shallot Mustard.name: ground pepper

Boneless Pork Chop with Shallot Mustard.originalString: 1 pinch Italian seasoning, or to taste
Boneless Pork Chop with Shallot Mustard.name: italian seasoning

Boneless Pork Chop with Shallot Mustard:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
  2. Season pork chops with salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning.
  3. Heat butter and olive oil together in a skillet over medium-high heat until butter begins to foam; cook pork chops in the hot butter-oil mixture until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side.
  4. Transfer pork chops to a baking dish, keeping the pan juices in skillet.
  5. Bake pork chops in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, 10 to 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
  6. Cook and stir onion and shallots in the skillet with pan juices over medium heat until softened, 3 to 5 minutes.
  7. Pour chicken stock and cooking wine into onion mixture, and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.
  8. Whisk half-and-half, horseradish mustard, lemon juice, and thyme into onion mixture until mustard sauce is smooth and heated through, about 5 minutes.
  9. Serve pork chops drizzled with mustard sauce.

Best Ever Party Appetizer.originalString: 1 cup oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, drained and diced
